Name: Sales Quality Business Analyst, Speech Analyst
Description: Sales Quality Business Analyst, Speech Analyst ==============================================Location: Greenway Plaza, Houston, Texas Job type: Permanent  Direct Energy is one of North America s largest retail providers of  electricity, natural gas, and home and business energy-related  services with over four million customers. Direct Energy gives  customers choice, simplicity, and innovation where energy, data, and  technology meet. A subsidiary of Centrica plc (LSE: CNA), an  international energy and services company, Direct Energy, its  subsidiaries and/or affiliates, operate in 50 U.S. states plus the  District of Columbia and eight provinces in Canada. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:Establish a detailed understanding of our strategies, vendor requirements, and regulatory concerns as they apply to our  business Look for opportunities where gaps may exist between our stated practices and actual practices. Elevate significant gaps to  executive management Based on your detailed understanding of our practices, calibrate Call Miner tool so it best reflects the content of our calls,  highlighting areas of concern within our calls, as well as best  practices Learn the mechanics of the CM product with the goal of being Direct Energy s content expert on this tool While this is not an IT role, you should have familiarity with the mechanics of the CM and how it relates to our various collection  databases. This includes how data is accumulated and how it flows  through the process all the way from the call itself to the CM  output Analyze the daily data input into CM to ensure its completeness and accuracy. Recommend process or improvement to the data feed  into the CM tool to maximize the value of using this tool Improve our CM scripting to ensure our calls are properly graded by the CM software. This will entail learning the scripting  language as well as writing the scripts to both capture  potential call issues, as well as to minimize false positives on  the calls Analyze the feedback within the CM environments looking for areas of consistent high performance, as well as areas of operational  improvements. Look for trends in the data, and isolate patterns by  client, site, collector, etc. Use this data to enhance the  collector scorecard and provide regular feedback to the executives  as well as the management team Determine weaknesses in our compliance and/or training program through the feedback received in the CM analytics. Recommend  logical next steps to improve our processes to close any gaps or  areas of concern Establish a set of executive level reports to bring forward the most relevant data Present the most relevant data in a clear and consistent manner to easily display any trends, etc. Develop a dashboard that includes  trending information.  EXPERIENCE Computer skills in the following areas: CallMiner, Excel,  Power Point, etc.  EDUCATION Bachelor Degree from four-year College or University, four  or five years of related business experience or administrative skills  or professional functions.  Direct Energy and its subsidiaries are an Equal Opportunity Employer  EOE/AA/Veterans/Disabled.  Centrica is committed to working with and providing reasonable  accommodation to individuals with physical and mental disabilities.  If you need special assistance or an accommodation while seeking  employment, please email **********************************. We will  make a determination of your request for a reasonable accommodation on  a case-by-case basis.  PLEASE APPLY ONLINE by hitting the 'Apply' button.  Applications will ONLY be accepted via the Apply button.  This role is being handled by the Centrica recruitment team and NO  agency contact is required.

Name: Business Intelligence Analyst- Sales
Description: ORGANIZATION SUMMARY Weatherford is one of the largest multinational oilfield service companies providing innovative solutions, technology and services to the oil and gas industry. The Company operates in over 90 countries and has a network of approximately 1,000 locations, including manufacturing, service, research and development, and training facilities and employs approximately 29,500 people. For more information, visit www.weatherford.com and connect with Weatherford on LinkedIn, Twitter, YouTube and Facebook.  Weatherford delivers innovative technologies and services designed to meet the world's current and future energy needs in a safe, ethical, and sustainable manner. Grounded by our core values and inspired by our world-class people, we are committed to being a trusted business partner to those we serve. JOB DESCRIPTION Supports the sales and marketing effort through the collection, analysis and reporting of sales and marketing data. Drives and supports the use of Salesforce; supports with the compilation and submission of tenders, compiles and circulates weekly and monthly reports. Assists in the development and implementation of business intelligence tools and solutions. Analyzes and reports on historical and future trends in performance, return and depreciation. Provides commercial and sales oversight, leadership and support to the sales team. DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES: Manage and synthesize external and internal sales data in order to develop and/or make decisions on business strategy. Prepare and report results of analysis and present as needed.  Provide information and analysis to management to be used in management decision making.  Create and manage a knowledge management system for all customer and market information to be shared effectively across the business unit group and business development team.  Prepare briefing and presentation material for management to support their Product Line performance with management.  Ensure that market intelligence from external sources is being effectively archived and utilized and that it meets the unique needs of Management, and where appropriate Product Lines (PL's) and Regions.  Provide support in the identification, analysis, design, planning and implementation of business process improvement initiatives.  Developing Forecasting and Variance Explanations.  Must understand and comply with all safety rules and company policies of Weatherford.  Know and understand Weatherford SRO Quality Policy and comply with all requirements of the Quality Systems Manual, Operating and Technical Procedures and Workplace Instructions.  Perform various other duties and activities as assigned by supervisor within the physical constraints of the job.  Provide support to Account Managers and Strategic Account Managers in analysis, planning and implementation of pricing improvement action plans. QUALIFICATIONS Must be able to coordinate, prioritize and meet multiple deadlines in demanding environment  Degree in Engineering/Accounting / Finance  Superior analytical and problem solving skills  Ability to communicate information of a complex nature to various levels of management and external clients (written & verbal) in an easy to understand business language  Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel, Access and other MS office software  Ability to respond to an emergency situation. Preferred: Ability to understand the impact of moderately complex changes, formulate test/plans conditions to minimize risks and recommend appropriate business and system solutions  Technical, project management and organizational skills  Possess strong data management technical understanding POSITION SPECIFIC DETAILS Weatherford offers competitive compensation and benefits upon hire; including paid vacation to start, matching 401K program, comprehensive benefits program, and employee stock purchase program (ESPP) and opportunities for on-going training and career development. VEVRAA Federal Contractor Priority Referral Requested  Weatherford is an Equal Opportunity Employer Females/ Minorities/ Veterans/Disabled and gives consideration for employment to qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.

Name: Grad - Business Analyst
Description: Position Location: Motiva Corporate Office; Houston, TX Position Overview: The Motiva Accelerate Graduate Program is designed to offer you the training, opportunities, and support you need to develop your leadership skills and form the foundation of a remarkable career.  Throughout the program, you'll have access to a range of training and development opportunities tailored to enhance your engineering skills and prepare you for your professional future with Motiva. Combinations vary by business line with examples such as: special projects, rotations, company integration, development, progress checks and assessments. Coaching and mentoring, as well as regular process checks, help to ensure we are doing everything we can to help you reach your full potential. Responsibilities: Graduate level business analysts within our trading organization may fill various roles as a scheduler and analyst. Job responsibilities for graduates may include: Business Analysis:Provide business and economic analysis, modeling, advice, and management information to the business with focus on enhancing quality of business decisions, identifying business improvement activities, and improving quality & predictability of business/financial performance.Proactively provide actionable information that directs the attention and energy of the organization (this is not a typical "record & report" role).Serve as the coordinator of the annual business planning cycle, developing Business Plan and evergreen updates as required.Lead the business planning & forecasting process, maintain & improve the Forward View business profitability forecasting tool and associated processes, drive process streamlining, facilitate learning opportunities.Run and maintain variable cost tracking tool/process, analyzing variable cost trends and identifying improvement opportunities.Assist in monthly business results analysis process to identify trends and opportunity areas. ? Run, maintain and improve business management information and supporting processes.Run, maintain, and improve the short-to-midterm business forecasting tool & supporting processes.Identify & assess key performance indicators and trends, assess impact of dynamic business/market variables, risks & exposures (e.g. feedstocks, product mix, contract pricing structures) to profitability & cash flow.Coordination, development, & simplification of Business Plan & Evergreen updates and supporting processes.Support the business strategy development and execution by providing various financial and/or strategic modeling, analysis, assessments (qualitative & quantitative).Complete projects to optimize the supply chain, which may include:Time-movement study of our flows to and from the refinery, providing data insights and recommendation on areas for improvement.Fuel oil arbitrage analysis for flows to and from the US and other locations.Revision of the current Return Profile on our OPEX investments, providing additional data analysis for a more inclusive review (i.e. not just P&L).Technical analysis of non-traditional indicators (i.e. price history) that have high correlations and predictive capabilities.Freight rate historical review and impact spreads on fuel oil/vacuum gas oil arbitrage, seeking predictive indicators.Strategic literature review of fuel oil markets and predicting mass balance impacts on Fuel Oil Market 2017-2020.Vessel and tankage utilization tracking. o Chloride testing methods for fuel oil & VGO.Crude Planning & Scheduling:Develop hydrocarbons and logistics schedules for assigned geography. Includes executing these movements according to the optimal supply plan, which meets demand and maximizes Enterprise value.Execute activities related to oil products movements and handling whereby ensuring compliance with local requirementsCoordinate movements of products through various modes of transportation (marine, pipe, rail, and truck) and with various business groupsSupport Supply Negotiators with development and management of contracts.Investigate and respond to rate inquiries; manage rate spreadsheet and communicate & make rate changes internally.Manage contract timelines & calendar.Track performance indicators and maintain terminal scorecards.Support management with preparation and analysis of various presentations and contractsComplete projects to optimize the supply chain, which may involve: viscosity blending, crude compatibility, tankage utilization, blend economics, crude pipeline blending, market analysis, and/or asset value analysis.Basic Qualifications:3.0 cumulative GPAPursuing a B.S. or M.S. in Engineering, Business, Finance or EconomicsStrong computer skills, MS Windows, MS office and MS ExcelStrong computation and technical skillsExcellent time management skillsGood communication skills, both written and oralCandidates must be a U.S. citizen or national, an alien admitted as permanent resident, refugee, asylee, temporary resident, or an individual who possesses valid work authorization. Individuals with temporary visas (H-1, H-2, J-1, F-1, etc.) or who require sponsorship for work authorization now or in the future are not eligible for hire.Preferred Qualifications:Previous internship experience is a plusProven leadership and/or participation in extracurricular activities preferredOther work experience not related to position/area of study will be taken into consideration Please note: We occasionally amend or withdraw Motiva jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to the advertised closing date.  Before applying, you are advised to read our data protection policy. This policy describes the processing that may be associated with your personal data and informs you that your personal data may be transferred to Motiva affiliates and service providers.. Name: Technical Business Analyst
Description: Must have requirment: Must be experienced in SCRUM Methodology Smartbridge is growing and we're looking for a Technical Business Analysts to join our team in Houston, TX! Smartbridge is a full-service consulting firm simplifying business transformation for enterprise businesses. Our clients range from emerging mid-market businesses to Fortune 500 companies. We specialize in creating exceptional solutions for a range of industries including restaurant, oil and gas, manufacturing, construction, facilities maintenance, and more.  At Smartbridge, we are committed to building a long and enduring relationship with our employees, and to creating an environment that encourages and empowers. Our goal is to exceed our employees' expectations in the same way that we strive to exceed our clients' expectations. We offer an environment that celebrates innovation and helps you to achieve a good balance between your professional and personal life. We strive to be an employer of choice!  Some quick facts about working at Smartbridge, and some of the benefits our employees enjoy: Company-paid medical insurance for employees (no premiums!)401(k) savings plan with company matchAnnual performance bonus opportunityProfit sharing opportunityPersonal Time Off (PTO) + 9 paid holidays + personal dayProfessional development program that includes tuition assistance & company paid trainingStrong mentorship programCompany-paid on-premises fitness centerCell phone reimbursementRewarding employee referral bonus programWork in an environment that supports innovation and collaborationQuarterly team events & company-wide hackathonsJob Description: Smartbridge is seeking both Senior and Mid-Level Technical Business Analysts who are experienced with Scrum Methodology. We have both Contract and Full-Time opportunities available.  As a Technical Business Analyst at Smartbridge, you will work on various consulting projects to help clients implement business strategies by delivering digital innovative technology, people, and process solutions. In this position, you may work on implementing business process improvements, enterprise systems including financial, supply chain and human resource systems, as well as business intelligence and analytics systems. You may have multiple roles on a project including gathering business requirements, creating functional designs, implementing system configurations, and functional testing.  As an IT Business Analyst at Smartbridge, you will have the opportunity to: Help clients succeed in their business transformation enabled by Digital InnovationPerform analysis of business issues, provide recommendations for possible solutions, work with Business users and technology professionals to drive decision making and define requirements for application development, ensuring that business needs are being metPerform a wide range of project functions in a fast-paced team environmentParticipate in and lead various components of projects in agile/scrum methodologiesSupport project initiatives by analyzing preliminary business requirements and defining project scopeAnalyze and document business processesGenerate quality documentation for business processes and workflow, including flowcharts and process narrativesSupport the team on other projects including ad-hoc analysis, proof of concepts and preparing presentationsAnalyze opportunities to improve application reliability, provide recommendations for possible solutions, and work with IT and Business partners to implement solutions that enhance application and infrastructure reliabilityEstablish priorities, meet deadlines and manage competing priorities under pressureProvide accurate and consistent status reports to clients and other stakeholdersTravel to client locations if requiredRequirements:3 - 5 years of experience in business analysis of business transformation, digital innovation, Enterprise Resource Planning and/or Business Intelligence systemsMust be experienced in SCRUM MethodologyPrevious consulting experienceDemonstrate strong analytical skills and develop solutions to problems independently and through facilitated team discussionsProven experience with business process analysis and developing process designsProven organizational skills with the ability to develop a detailed work plan to ensure project successDemonstrated ability to organize and facilitate large cross-functional meetingsAdept and proactive at problem-solving and conflict resolutionLearn new concepts and technologies fast and apply in an agile mannerAbility to interact and build long-term business relationships with all levels of professionalsPerform thorough requirement interviews with project stakeholdersThe ability to analyze and develop business scenarios and use casesWorking experience with data analysis tools such as Tableau, PowerBI, SQL is highly desiredExperience with development methodologies is highly desiredExperience with business process improvement work, and process flow modelingExcellent written and verbal communication skillsAmbitious, energetic, and willing to learn and growOutstanding research skillsProficiency in Microsoft Office (Outlook, Word, Excel, Access, PowerPoint)Education: Bachelors degree (information systems/finance/business administration/supply chain management or related field preferred); knowledge of theories, principles, and concepts typically acquired through completion of a bachelors degree.Your Future Working Environment If you join Smartbridge you can make great ideas happen for some of the world's most dynamic companies. With broad global resources and deep technical know-how, we collaborate with clients to cultivate ideas and deliver results. We ideate, conduct hackathons to prove our ideas and develop new skills in our people, and bring such ideas to our clients. Choose a career at Smartbridge and enjoy an innovative environment where challenging and interesting work is part of daily life.  We partner with customers in their journey from vision to adoption, and across the plethora of technology options available today. Smartbridges comprehensive list of technology and software partnerships gives us the freedom to remain an objective collaborator with our customers. The suite of Smartbridge services includes Digital Innovation, Systems Modernization, Applications Integration, Data Management, Business Intelligence & Analytics, Enterprise Mobility and Blockchain.  An empathetic approach to understanding customer challenges is bred into the Smartbridge culture. It is evidenced by our ability to bring ideation to life for customers and ourselves. As thought leaders with a track record of successful project execution, Smartbridge is committed to fueling your innovation.  Next to our excellent terms of employment and fringe benefits, we invest considerable resources to provide on-going training that builds and extends professional, technical and management skills in all areas. At Smartbridge you will operate in a professional environment where entrepreneurship is hugely encouraged.

Name: Entry Level Business Consultant
Description: Are you customer focused, resourceful, and looking to start your career with a leading provider of automotive retailing solutions? Then consider joining our team! Reynolds and Reynolds, one of the top providers of premium integrated computer solutions for automotive dealerships, is seeking Business Consultants to join our growing team of professionals in Houston, TX. As an Entry Level Business Consultant, you will be responsible for providing high level customer service and software utilization consulting to our dealership customers. Functioning as a consultant, you will be responsible for providing support for our new products, with the ultimate goal of helping our customers realize maximum value from the software tools they have purchased. Most of this consulting will be done over the internet via video-conferencing technology. You will be able to analyze the customer’s software usage and target specific tools and solutions to maximize their operational effectiveness. You will begin with an intensive five (5) month paid training program located at our office in Houston, TX. Training for this role will consist of combined classroom instruction and online courses. The courses consist of in-depth product training as well as automotive industry knowledge. You will also be partnered with a mentor to train in the field where you can apply your classroom knowledge in a real-world setting. Throughout training you will participate in Role plays, Demos, and Case Studies with plenty of real world examples.After your training, you will split time between the Houston office and your home office. When working from home, you will perform the video-conference customer meetings and when working from our office, you will work on training and departmental improvement projects.REQUIREMENTS: Bachelor’s DegreeMust be a self-starter with good time management skillsStrong written and verbal communication skillsExcellent customer service and organizational skillsAbility to build strong customer relationshipsAbility to travel periodically (quarterly) for a week of customer visitsLiving in or willing to relocate to Houston, TX areaBENEFITS:We strive to offer an environment that provides our associates with the right balance between work and family. We offer a comprehensive benefits package including:Medical, dental, vision, and life insurance401k with 100% matching up to 6% of compensationReferral bonuses with the opportunity to earn up to $7,000 per hirePaid holidays, vacation, and sick daysProfessional development and training through ‘Reynolds University’Discounted membership to local area fitness centersCompany-sponsored events and sports leagues including: company picnic, softball, volleyball, bowling, and more!Gourmet cafeteria, open for breakfast and lunch, that features a salad bar and a variety of made-to-order cuisine optionsOpportunities to participate in charitable endeavors, such as our annual Bike Build for local military families, participation in the Reynolds Associate Foundation, company sponsorship in local charity 5k Run/Walks, and other volunteer opportunitiesABOUT OUR COMPANY: Established in 1866, Reynolds and Reynolds offers the Retail Management System – a complete suite of products and services for automotive dealerships. Reynolds solutions are built as one, to work as one, for all areas of the dealership. While headquartered in Dayton, Ohio, Reynolds has offices all over the world, employing more than 4,300 associates. We offer a variety of opportunities: Energizing projects, high-powered teaming, constant learning, and professional growth. Reynolds and Reynolds promotes a healthy lifestyle by providing a non-smoking environment.Reynolds and Reynolds encourages applicants of all ages and experience to apply, as we do not discriminate on the basis of age.

Name: IT Business Analyst

We are headquartered in Houston, Texas with over 300 employees. DISA is highly committed to quality and service excellence.DISA employees are offered a competitive pay and benefits package and a fun and exciting place to work. We have a collaborative and team-oriented culture with numerous opportunities of career advancement. Responsibilities:Advise management in areas of concern with regard to business areas in need of an IT solution or IT solutions falling short of business needAdvise IT development and support personnel of business drivers and functional requirements behind IT projects as well as potential technical methods that could better address functional requirementsAssist in implementation of and training of business stakeholders in use of new IT solutionsPerforms feasibility analysis, scopes projects, and works with the project management team to prioritizes deliverables, and negotiate on product functionalitiesCreates detailed Business Requirement Documents (BRD) and translates into functional specificationsReview functional and design specifications and\work with development team and business stakeholders to ensure full understanding of individual IT deliverablesProvides analytic support by coordinating data extraction from various databases and data interpretation.Assists, facilitates and participates in Integration Testing and User Acceptance Testing (UAT) and Functionality Testing.Qualifications required:3 to 5 years of related job experience working in a business analyst or directly in business operational roleExposure to software and hardware design principlesExposure to programming technologies such as C#, ASP.NET, SQL Server, Java, Relational Database Design, Object-Oriented programming, and other web-interface technologiesQualifications desired:Bachelor’s DegreeDISAWorks® system experience 2 to 3 years of experience in a software development or support roleEOE/M/F/Vet/Disability

Name: Business Analyst - Reverse Mortgage
Description: ONLY GREEN CARD / US CITIZEN / GC-EAD RequiredRole:Business Analyst - Reverse Mortgage**Location: Houston, TXDuration: Full Time PermanentNote: NO C2C, NO C2H, NO REMOTE, NO H1B TRANSFERExperience RequiredOverall 6-8 years of Business Analysis experience in Reverse Mortgage domain.3-5 years in documenting Product Backlogs (PBI), Epic, User stories, Burn down charts under the Agile/SCRUM Methodology * Extensive knowledge of Mortgage processing, and closing procedures (Preferred)Understanding of mortgage concepts like HE, HELOC, Reverse mortgages, Rate locks, ARM attributes etc. (preferred)Experience documenting requirements (business & system requirements)Experience using tools like JIRA, Rally or TFS. * Document functional requirements across all technical aspects of the solution (UI, business rules, BRD, FRS, Use-cases, AS-IS and To-be process flows, technical integrations) Job Type: Full-time  Salary: $85,000.00 to $100,000.00 /year

Name: Business Operations Analyst
Description: Responsible for planning, scheduling and coordinating demand/supply management, business processes and/or manufacturing/delivery of products and services to the company policy and country regulatory requirements. Partners with stakeholders to identify/implement opportunities for business process improvement to effectively manage costs, integrate new and existing businesses, and adapt to changes in the business and regulatory environment. Time horizon is typically focused on less than six months for forecasting/planning. Leading and working with cross-functional teams, creates and implements plans that enable the execution of business strategies. Participates in the process by which demand signals are developed, validated for alignment with transition plans, supply constraints identified, and an executable plan defined that meets financial and market share goals. Scope includes business execution processes related to lifecycle planning; order management (including allocation management, Available to Promise (ATP)/commit processes, business attainment tracking); logistics management (including inbound/outbound coordination and consolidation of domestic and international systems to support shipments); and inventory management (including analysis, optimization and velocity). Partners cross-functionally to develop, track and manage business metrics for the organization (may include customer availability, service levels, on-time delivery, supplier response time (SRTs), supply chain costs and inventory. Responsibilities:Responsible for supply chain processes, such as inventory analysis, order fulfillment, import/export operations and shipping, for a country or regional business unit with minimum supervision applying discretion and judgement.Compiles key metrics, produces reports, and analyzes data using IT systems for demand and supply matching activities.Analysis of backlog management.Gathers demand data from country and region for demand planning.Reviews current business process for regional and global business unit planning teams.Reviews performance metrics on a regular basis, identifying opportunities for improvement.Education and Experience Required:First level university degree or equivalent experience.Typically 0-2 years of experience in a supply chain function.Knowledge and Skills:Good understanding of supply chain processes (plan, source, make deliver).Demonstrated analytical skills.Strong written and verbal communication skills; mastery in English and local language.Good interpersonal skills.Basic Microsoft Office skills (Excel, PowerPoint, etc.).Basic understanding of project management methodology.Developing business acumen and technical knowledge within area of responsibility.Introduction to the company's overall supply chain strategy.Basic understanding of Material Requirements Planning (MRP) and ATP.Basic understanding of import/export regulatory requirements and compliance.Basic knowledge of inventory analysis. 1036930Hewlett Packard Enterprise is EEO F/M/Protected Veteran/ Individual with Disabilities. HPE will comply with all applicable laws related to the use of arrest and conviction records, including the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance and similar laws and will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories.

Name: Business System Analyst - ETRM
Description: Job Title:Business System Analyst - ETRMLocation:Sugar LandFull-Time/Part-Time:Full-timeAlternate Posting Locations:Job Description:POSITION SUMMARYThe ETRM Business System Analyst\Programmer will provide front-line support and problem analysis for RightAngle. Key activities are to manage the relationship with business users, and support software integrations, configuration, upgrade, testing, troubleshooting, enhancement and bug fixing. The ETRM Business System Analyst must have strong analytical scale and ability to learn and understand business operation, understand the urgency of issues, drive and own tasks until completed. He \she must be a team player, and work with the rest of ETRM system team to support CVR commercial applications.He\She will be responsible for coordinating resolution to incidents, service requests, enhancement requests and application/system fixes to resolve production issues.The ETRM Business System Analyst must have strong oral and written communication skills. He\she works directly with internal business users of RightAngle to provide real-time support. In the course of this support, the ETRM BSA manages the process of problem response, triage and manages the team's documentation of defects and communicates remediation. His or her knowledge and expertise is critical to the success of the teams strategy and tactical initiatives.EDUCATION REQUIREMENTSBachelor's Degree in Information Systems, Computer Science or other related scientific or technical discipline required; or demonstrated technical proficiency may be substituted for education requirementsEXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS2+ years of experience in business analyst and technical support roles and 5+ years development experiences in energy related business.Ability to articulate business operation issue and technical solution. Must be comfortable communicating with internal business users and senior management.Experience leading application support and maintaining production support activities.Experience in working with complex integrated Enterprise systems, troubleshooting systems and integration related issues and facilitating through issue resolution. Possess broad understanding of enterprise business/functional processes in finance, plant maintenance and operations, supply chain and other corporate areas.Display disciplines in incident management, problem management, change management, service requests and the resulting documentation.Understands complex applications functionality, triage issues and identifies and documents resulting resolutions and displaying competent problem solving skills.Knowledge and experience on Microsoft .Net development platforms, SQL Server and/or Oracle databases is a plus.Experience creating process flows with Visio and writing technical documentation.Experience working with QA and application deployment teams to move applications into productionAbility to partner with leadership team, peers, vendors, and subordinates to develop and enhance reporting capabilities in order to provide a suite of reports/dashboards ensuring customer needs are met.Fluent in English, oral and written requiredAbility to adjust schedule to meet business needsMAJOR ACCOUNTABILITIESIs a Key functional support on the team -- a bridge of Technical and Management skillsetsTaking a lead role in detecting, diagnosing and resolving system and application problems; conduct root cause analysis, submitting and managing incident tickets, following through on analysis, and developing methods for improvement.Collaborate on change implementation plans and strategies, performing risk and impact assessments prior to change implementation.Manages the delivery of exceptional customer service in a fast paced environment through phone, email and IM by consulting with management team, peers and subordinates and finally end users to clarify program intent, identify problems, suggest changes and document discussions/issues and translates changes into clear and actionable application directives.Provides and directs oversight of all vendors support and ensures incident resolutions and problems are correctly identified with the proposed final solution consistent with the end users' project requirements.Serves as a technical resource on lights-on projects and support activities, including coordination with business owners and reporting progress and status.Maintains an organization-wide view of business and application architecture with high-level visual schematic of key systems and business flows.Identify systems and business architectures with reliability or capacity risk; suggest remediation to improve serviceability.Identify areas within Application Support which can be made more efficient through automation, contribute ideas and solutions related to our transition to continuous delivery and work closely with team to contribute to the creation and implementation of such automationCreate automated solutions for application and infrastructure monitoring, with focus on exception based alerting; Leverage open source tools wherever practicalSupports SOA (Service Oriented Architecture) and MDM (Master Data Management) initiatives with business and technical perspective and understands the company's strategic objectives for future technical architectureEXPECTED RESULTSEstablish and maintain the documentation of the overall department goals at a consistently satisfactory level of ticket completion for the technician team.Manage and update application support documentation.Coordinate application relationship matrix across all service portfolios, in collaboration with the Application Development Manager.Maintain the Application Portfolio with clear definition of applications in Production, Test and Development, and current versions.Adherence to all company policies and procedures within department.CVR Energy is an Equal Opportunity Employer

Name: Business Data Analyst
Description: Job Summary/Primary Focus  The Business Data Analyst interfaces with internal and external sources for purchase and sales data including accounts payable/receivable departments, accounting and finance, Microsoft Dynamics AX and various internal SQL Server databases at Direct Energy North America Home to develop business intelligence for the BuyMax business' Rebate Division and Private Brands Division who serves Company owned locations, franchisees and other group buying members. The Business Data Analyst is responsible for creating dashboards and reporting methodology to track purchases, produces purchasing history and forecasting reports, pricing analytics for internal customers such as senior management, finance and rebate administration.  Developing and managing data import, extraction and reporting processes from multiple internal and external systems to develop a sourcing data warehouse and developing spend analytics from existing ERP systems are the key responsibilities for this role. This position will drive client engagement in our programs and increase our share of their purchases.  Key Responsibilities Build relationships between our Preferred Vendors and Distributors.Database maintenance and further development for Sourcing Data WarehouseMaintain and develop spend analytic reportingProvide spend analytics to support strategic sourcing projects across all businessesIdentify, evaluate and communicate to management the clients' utilization of products and services with notable trends for management to identify new or improved products, services, vendors or programs. Minimum Qualifications & Abilities Highest priority given to candidates with expert knowledge of SQL, Access, VBA, C-Sharp, Excel, and MS Dynamics AXBachelor Degree in Business or Finance, MBA preferredMust understand both the business practices and the technology used in our industryExcellent communication skills at all levelsExcellent consultative skills and project management experienceStrong planning and execution skills.High energy, self-motivated and goal oriented.Must be able to multi-task, work within deadlines and change priorities quickly.Willing to travel 20% Key Behaviors and Attributes Ability to work independentlyWorks well under pressureCompany Profile: Direct Energy generates electricity and produces natural gas, as well as selling commodities and servicing the energy needs of homes and businesses in 46 U.S. states plus the District of Columbia and 10 Canadian provinces. We also help our customers save on their energy bills through energy efficiency. Located in over 50 locations, our team of 6,000+ employees serve over 6 million residential and commercial customer relationships.  Direct Energy is a subsidiary of Centrica plc (LSE:CNA), one of the world's leading integrated energy companies with over 20 million customers and 34,000 employees worldwide. We are committed to being the most recommended energy and services provider and leading the transition to a low carbon society.  Direct Energy and its subsidiaries are an Equal Opportunity Employer - EOE AA M/F Vet/Disability  PLEASE APPLY ONLINE by hitting the 'Apply' button.  Applications will ONLY be accepted via the 'Apply' button.  This role is being handled by the Centrica recruitment team and NO agency contact is required.

Name: EPSi Business Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionThe ERP Business Analyst III - EPSi ensures that the operational interests of their respective functional areas are being fully represented in the day-to-day operations of the Information Technology Department. This role supports several applications deployed within the Harris Health System. This particular position supports our EPSi decision support application software and related interfaces with our PeopleSoft system. The role, scope and responsibilities include:Application support role in support of the EPSi decision support software; PeopleSoft Finance experience is good to have but this position will be supporting EPSi and related interfaces from a business analyst perspective;Our PeopleSoft interfaces with Epic as well but we will be developing several more interfaces.Strong budgeting and financial reporting background highly preferredMINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS: Education/Specialized Training/Licensure: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related degree, or four (4) years of related IT work experience in lieu of a degree.  Work Experience (Years and Area): 5 Years within Information System (I.S.). At least three (3) years PeopleSoft, Kronos experience. EPSi support experience along with budgeting, accounting and financial reporting highly preferred.The ideal candidate will have the following qualities:EPSi support experienceExcellent communication skillsBudgeting, accounting and financial reporting skillsEager to learn new skills SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS: Communication Skills: Above Average Verbal (Heavy Public Contact)  Exceptional Verbal (e.g., Public Speaking)  Writing /Composing (Correspondence / Reports) Other Skills: Analytical, Design, Research, Statistical Advanced Education: Bachelors Degree Major: Computer Science or Related  Work Schedule: On Call Other Requirements: Understands functional processes and business rules related to the applications being implemented/supported.  Understands the limitations and opportunities presented by the applications supported.  Understands how application layer security is assigned and works.  Demonstrates adaptability and flexibility in the face of changing demands.  Ability to exceed customer expectation, quality, and productivity.  Provide production support for the ERP applications, including participation in a 24×7 on-call support rotation.  Participate in production changes that may occur after 5:00p.m. or on weekendsCompany DescriptionHarris Health is a nationally recognized health system comprising three teaching hospitals and an extensive network of ambulatory care centers serving the people of Harris County, Texas, since 1966. Staffed by the faculty, fellows and residents from two nationally ranked medical schools, Baylor College of Medicine and The University of Texas Health Science Center at Houston (UTHealth), Harris Health is the first healthcare system in Houston to receive the prestigious National Committee for Quality Assurance (NCQA) designation for its network of patient-centered medical homes.  Each year, Harris Health provides more than 1.8 million total outpatient visits through its more than 40 ambulatory care facilities. Additionally, Harris Health sees more than 177,000 emergency visits at its Level 1 and Level 3 trauma centers and 35,000 hospital admissions through its three hospitals: Ben Taub, LBJ and Quentin Mease.  Established by voter referendum to enhance the level of charity care available in the community, Harris Health System has often received national recognition for serving those in need and for its achievements in operational excellence, such as being named to the 2011, 2012, 2013 and 2014 Most Wired Hospitals lists by the American Hospital Association’s Hospitals & Health Networks magazine.  Additionally, Harris Health System is pleased that each of its three hospitals — Ben Taub, Lyndon B. Johnson and Quentin Mease — achieved Pathway to ExcellenceTM designation by the American Nurses Credentialing Center.  Harris Health System benefits program is designed to provide you with more flexibility and choices in meeting your specific needs. Harris Health System benefits program allows you to protect your income in case of illness, death and disability, and to help you save for retirement.  It is the policy of Harris Health System to provide equal opportunity for all applicants for employment regardless political affiliation, race, color, national origin, age, sex, religious creed or disability. Applicants may request any reasonable accommodation(s) to participate in the application process.

Name: IT Business Analyst/QA Tester
Description: *IT Business Analyst/QA Tester***Description** Johnson Space Center is NASA?s hub for human spaceflight\. On the Jacobs JETS contract we provide a wide range of engineering and technical services to NASA at the Johnson Space Center\. Come join our team and contribute to the future of humanity in space\!  We are looking foran IT Business Analyst/QA Tester to collect and analyze requirements, document, and test software applications and systems\.  The selected candidate for this role will:  + Serve as the liaison between stakeholders and the development team\.  + Meet with stakeholders to collect, analyze, and document their business requirements, processes, and system goals\.  + Document existing software, database systems, and processes\.  + Create functional and non\-functional requirements, models, use cases, process flows, diagrams and charts, and other documentation to provide direction to developers\.  + Analyze/research user requests for possible changes or defects\.  + Ensure developed solutions meet customer needs\.  + Develop test plans, test cases, and test data based on requirements\.  + Design and maintain automation test scripts\.  + Perform production verification to ensure production implementations are functioning properly\.  + Perform other duties as required\. *Qualifications**Required Education/Experience/Skills: This position is posted at multiple levels\. Depending on the candidate?s experience, requirements and business needs, we reserve the right to consider candidates at any level for which this position has been advertised\.  + BS degree in a computer or system science discipline from an accredited college or university and a minimum of ten \(10\) years of progressive, relevant experience, or a MS degree in a computer or system science discipline from an accredited college or university and a minimum of eight \(8\) years of progressive experience, or a Ph\.D\. degree in a computer or system science discipline from an accredited college or university and a minimum of four \(4\) years of progressive experience\. Requires demonstrated and recognized technical expertise in specialty areas of engineering system design and analysis\.  + Must have experience gathering requirements for software/systems, and translating those requirement accurately to the software development team\.  + Must have an understanding of industry best practice requirements definition and system testing concepts\.  + Strong understanding of the full lifecycle \(SDLC\) with Agile/Scrum experience\.  + Strong understanding of web\-based applications\.  + Experience in Microsoft SQL\.  + Familiar with Microsoft Office products\.  + Self\-motivated, team player, and adaptable to a dynamic environment and the ability to complete all assignments as required\.  + Excellent oral and written communication skills\.  + Good problem solving skills\.  + Must have good time management skills and be able to handle multiple projects simultaneously\. Preferences: + Experience with test automation programs such as Selenium or similar applications\.  + SharePoint knowledge\.  Why Work for JETS?  + Opportunities for growth and advancement  + Comprehensive Medical Coverage \(medical, dental, vision\)  + 401\(k\)  + Benefits Tuition Reimbursement  + Much, much more\!  Don?t miss out on this great opportunity; for immediate consideration, apply now\! \( http://www\.wehavespaceforyou\.com/ \)\.  + Must be a U\.S\. Citizen and successfully complete a U\.S\. government background investigation\.  + Management has the prerogative to select at any level for which this position has been advertised\.  Essential Functions  Work Environment  Generally an office environment, but can involve inside or outside work depending on task\.  Physical Requirements  Work may involve sitting or standing for extended periods \(90% of time\)\. May require lifting and carrying up to 10 lbs \(5% of time\)\.  Equipment and Machines  Standard office equipment \(PC, telephone, printer, etc\.\)\.  Attendance  Regular attendance in accordance with established work schedule is critical\. Ability to work outside normal schedule and adjust schedule to meet peak periods and surge requirements when required\.  Other Essential Functions  Must be able to work in a team atmosphere\. Must put forward a professional behavior that enhances productivity and promotes teamwork and cooperation\. Grooming and dress must be appropriate for the position and must not impose a safety risk/hazard to the employee or others\.  Jacobs is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer\. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or other characteristics protected by law\. Jacobs is a background screening, drug\-free workplace\. *Primary Location** United States\-Texas\-Houston*Req ID:** AS00044P

We are headquartered in Houston, Texas with over 300 employees. We are IT innovators and developed one of the most advanced platforms to support our clients’ access to data. DISA is highly committed to quality and service excellence.DISA employees are offered a competitive pay and benefits package and a fun and exciting place to work. We have a collaborative and team-oriented culture with numerous opportunities of career advancement. We offer monthly appreciation events and strive to provide a learning environment where each employee is encouraged to participate in continuing education and training.Position Summary: Ensures and maintains the effectiveness of DISA’s IT solution delivery by evaluating business problems, challenges, and opportunities to identify optimal software solutions. Maintain ongoing contact with other business stakeholders as well as IT development and support staff to assess project progress and priorities, provide or seek input on solutions, assist in developing systems requirements and programming specifications, coordinate implementation of solutions, discuss new software tools, and\or identify software bugs. Responsibilities:Advise management in areas of concern with regard to business areas in need of an IT solution or IT solutions falling short of business needAdvise IT development and support personnel of business drivers and functional requirements behind IT projects as well as potential technical methods that could better address functional requirementsAssist in implementation of and training of business stakeholders in use of new IT solutionsPerforms feasibility analysis, scopes projects, and works with the project management team to prioritizes deliverables, and negotiate on product functionalitiesCreates detailed Business Requirement Documents (BRD) and translates into functional specificationsReview functional and design specifications and\work with development team and business stakeholders to ensure full understanding of individual IT deliverablesProvides analytic support by coordinating data extraction from various databases and data interpretation.Assists, facilitates and participates in Integration Testing and User Acceptance Testing (UAT) and Functionality Testing.Qualifications required:3 to 5 years of related job experience working in a business analyst or directly in business operational roleExposure to software and hardware design principlesExposure to programming technologies such as C#, ASP.NET, SQL Server, Java, Relational Database Design, Object-Oriented programming, and other web-interface technologiesQualifications desired:Bachelor’s DegreeDISAWorks® system experience 2 to 3 years of experience in a software development or support roleEOE/M/F/Vet/Disability

Name: Principal Analyst
Description: Job ID: 20181024-12841-AO Company Name: Wood Mackenzie  Description: We are looking for a Principal Analyst /Research Manager– Americas Gas and to join our Gas team in Houston. This is an opportunity to manage a small team within our Americas gas team delivering our research content for our wide range of clients. Our dedicated gas sector teams are located around the world, and deliver research and consulting projects.Together we work with a range of clients including national and major gas companies, utilities, investment banks and institutional investors.About you and how you can excel in this roleYou understand the value of data for business decision-making and want to work in a leading research, analytics and consultancy organisation. You are passionate about leadership and excellence as well US energy markets.You have an analytical, commercial mindset and can formulate leading-edge analysis from a variety of data and information. This is coupled with your ability to communicate highly complex or technical information, delivering messages that are easily understood. You have a strong understanding market analysis, good domain knowledge and a track record or recognised potential in coaching others .You are keen to develop your management skills, ideally having previously led or coached a small team but this is not essential. Playing a part in setting the business priorities, including the technical direction of your team, is important to you in how you lead, evaluate and develop your team of professionals.You have a proven track of fostering strong working relationships including coaching, influencing and developing others around you. The way in which you work is highly productive and driven, striving to be best in class and setting the standard for others to follow. You are focused on continuous improvement and play a key role in implementing better ways of working. About the roleAs part of a world-class group of industry experts, you will manage a team to deliver research publications and other work commitments in the Americas Gas. You will develop the analysts in your team, coaching and mentoring through learning ‘on the job’, and providing career development advice and guidance. You will foster a supportive and dynamic team high performing environment. A key priority for you will be to ensure that a high level of quality in all content is consistently delivered by your team. You will foster collaboration with other teams to maintain close alignment on cross-team issues. You will define team or research project operating standards to ensure essential procedures are followed.Given your engagement with your network of industry contacts, you will actively maintain these relationships as part of enhancing our reputation for industry-leading analysis and expertise. This will shape how your team remains current on latest developments by promoting and supporting them to develop a broad range of productive relationships with industry contacts. Your contributions will be highly influential from the beginning. You will be expected to lead the way as we value high levels of client contact and pride ourselves in answering their questions.What you’ll love about Wood Mackenzie For the past 45 years, we have established our reputation as a trusted source of knowledge and forward- looking insight for the world’s most innovative organisations. Our teams are located around the world, and deliver research and consulting projects based on our assessment and valuation of thousands of individual assets, companies and economic indicators such as market supply, demand and price trends. As a result, we can count the world’s key energy institutions and governments among our most loyal clients.We are committed to supporting our people to grow and thrive. We value different perspectives and aspire to create an inclusive environment that encourages diversity and fosters a sense of belonging. We value everyone’s contribution and support them to reach their full potential while sustaining an organisational culture of health and well-being. There are opportunities to get involved in our Wellness, Diversity and Inclusion, and Community Engagement initiatives. We actively support flexible working and are happy to consider alternative work patterns, taking into account your needs and the needs of the team or division that you are looking to join. Hear what our team has to say about working with us:https://www.woodmac.com/careers/our-people/We are part of a company that has been named as a Best Employer by ForbesMagazine and on the Forbes Most Innovative Companies list three years running. Verisk is one of only 15 out of 500 companies to appear on both lists. We are proud to be a part of the Verisk family of companies!What you’ll love about Verisk Verisk Analytics has an amazing story to tell. In 2017, Forbes magazine named Verisk to its World’s Most Innovative Companies list for the third consecutive year and to its America’s Best Mid-Size Employers list. We also earned the Great Place to Work® Certification for the second consecutive year in recognition of our outstanding workplace culture.Verisk is a leading data analytics provider serving customers in insurance, natural resources, and financial services. We’ve been delivering data, analytics, and decision support services to our customers for more than 45 years, helping them protect people, property, and financial assets. At Verisk, you’ll be part of an organization that’s committed to serving the long-term interests of our stakeholders, including the communities where we operate.At Verisk, you can build an exciting career with meaningful work; create a positive and lasting impact on the business; and find the support, coaching, and training you need to advance your career. Our culture of innovation means your ideas on how to improve our business will be heard. As key contributors to our success, our team members enjoy working in a business-casual, collaborative environment that offers state-of-the-art resources, advanced technologies, and an excellent benefits package.Verisk Analytics is an equal opportunity employer.All members of the Verisk Analytics family of companies are equal opportunity employers. We consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, citizenship, sex, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, veteran's status, age or disability.http://www.verisk.com/careers.html Requirements:  Education Bachelors (or equivalent work experience)  Job Type Full Time  Location TX-Houston  Years of Experience 5-8 Years

Name: Business System Analyst - ETRM
Description: Business System Analyst - ETRMPOSITION SUMMARY The ETRM Business System Analyst\Programmer will provide front-line support and problem analysis for RightAngle. Key activities are to manage the relationship with business users, and support software integrations, configuration, upgrade, testing, troubleshooting, enhancement and bug fixing.  The ETRM Business System Analyst must have strong analytical scale and ability to learn and understand business operation, understand the urgency of issues, drive and own tasks until completed. He \she must be a team player, and work with the rest of ETRM system team to support commercial applications.  He\She will be responsible for coordinating resolution to incidents, service requests, enhancement requests and application/system fixes to resolve production issues.  The ETRM Business System Analyst must have strong oral and written communication skills. He\she works directly with internal business users of RightAngle to provide real-time support. In the course of this support, the ETRM BSA manages the process of problem response, triage and manages the team's documentation of defects and communicates remediation. His or her knowledge and expertise is critical to the success of the teams strategy and tactical initiatives. EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS Bachelor's Degree in Information Systems, Computer Science or other related scientific or technical discipline required; or demonstrated technical proficiency may be substituted for education requirements EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS2+ years of experience in business analyst and technical support roles5+ years development experiences in energy related business.Ability to articulate business operation issue and technical solution. Must be comfortable communicating with internal business users and senior management.Experience leading application support and maintaining production support activities.Experience in working with complex integrated Enterprise systems, troubleshooting systems and integration related issues and facilitating through issue resolution. Possess broad understanding of enterprise business/functional processes in finance, plant maintenance and operations, supply chain and other corporate areas.Display disciplines in incident management, problem management, change management, service requests and the resulting documentation.Understands complex applications functionality, triage issues and identifies and documents resulting resolutions and displaying competent problem solving skills.Knowledge and experience on Microsoft .Net development platforms, SQL Server and/or Oracle databases is a plus.Experience creating process flows with Visio and writing technical documentation.Experience working with QA and application deployment teams to move applications into productionAbility to partner with leadership team, peers, vendors, and subordinates to develop and enhance reporting capabilities in order to provide a suite of reports/dashboards ensuring customer needs are met.Fluent in English, oral and written requiredAbility to adjust schedule to meet business needsMAJOR ACCOUNTABILITIESIs a Key functional support on the team -- a bridge of Technical and Management skillsetsTaking a lead role in detecting, diagnosing and resolving system and application problems; conduct root cause analysis, submitting and managing incident tickets, following through on analysis, and developing methods for improvement.Collaborate on change implementation plans and strategies, performing risk and impact assessments prior to change implementation.Manages the delivery of exceptional customer service in a fast paced environment through phone, email and IM by consulting with management team, peers and subordinates and finally end users to clarify program intent, identify problems, suggest changes and document discussions/issues and translates changes into clear and actionable application directives.Provides and directs oversight of all vendors support and ensures incident resolutions and problems are correctly identified with the proposed final solution consistent with the end users' project requirements.Serves as a technical resource on lights-on projects and support activities, including coordination with business owners and reporting progress and status.Maintains an organization-wide view of business and application architecture with high-level visual schematic of key systems and business flows.Identify systems and business architectures with reliability or capacity risk; suggest remediation to improve serviceability.Identify areas within Application Support which can be made more efficient through automation, contribute ideas and solutions related to our transition to continuous delivery and work closely with team to contribute to the creation and implementation of such automationCreate automated solutions for application and infrastructure monitoring, with focus on exception based alerting; Leverage open source tools wherever practicalSupports SOA (Service Oriented Architecture) and MDM (Master Data Management) initiatives with business and technical perspective and understands the company's strategic objectives for future technical architectureEXPECTED RESULTSEstablish and maintain the documentation of the overall department goals at a consistently satisfactory level of ticket completion for the technician team.Manage and update application support documentation.Coordinate application relationship matrix across all service portfolios, in collaboration with the Application Development Manager.Maintain the Application Portfolio with clear definition of applications in Production, Test and Development, and current versions.Adherence to all company policies and procedures within department.

Name: Business Analyst III - IT
Description: The Business Analyst III (BI-BA3) will elicit, analyze, validate, specify, verify, and manage the real needs of Business Intelligence (BI) Department customers, team members, and management. This team member will be the primary business engagement resource. Responsibilities will include identifying demand, defining and documenting requirements, monitoring development progress, conducting quality assurance exercises, ensuring deliverables are met, and managing expectations. The BA III will serve as a conduit between the various internal hospital users, and the BI Department project teams through which requirements specifications will flow. In addition, the BA III may also act as a Project Manager from time to time. DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIESEngage customers and elicit requirements using various methods, including RAD design/development methods in conjunction with RAD developers.Development and maintenance of project documentation.Lead virtual project teams.Creation of requirements specifications using natural language simply, clearly, unambiguously, and concisely.Decompose high-level business and user requirements into functional requirements and quality, specified in an appropriate level of detail suitable for use by those responsible for basing their work on said requirements.Define quality attributes, external interfaces, constraints, and other nonfunctional requirements.Represent requirements using alternative views, such as analysis models (diagrams), prototypes, or scenarios, where appropriate.Lead requirements analysis and verification, ensuring that requirement statements a re complete, consistent, concise, comprehensible, traceable, feasible, unambiguous, and verifiable, and that they conform to standards.Participate in peer reviews and inspections of requirements documents, and reviews of work product derived from requirements specifications to ensure that they were interpreted correctly.Responsible for ensuring effective two way communication within the project teams, and with customers.Responsible for identifying, raising, and facilitating resolution of issues that arise during the course of a project.May provide team leadership for other BA team members.Engage with customers to assess and address needs within the scope of approved development methodologies.Mentor other team members with one on one training when possible.Performs other duties as assigned.EDUCATION REQUIREMENTSBachelors degree in Computer Science, Business Administration, Health Administration, or related discipline required.EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS4 - 8 years experience in the Health Care Industry. Knowledge of clinical and financial operations in a hospital environment a plus.4 - 8 years experience working with computer systems, including Microsoft Professional tools.  2+ years working with information technology teams on development projects.  Some experience with tools such as Microsoft Analysis Services, SQL, VBA, C#, ASP.Net. or similar technologies required.  Experience integrating new and existing clinical database environments.SPECIAL KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES REQUIRED Interviewing Skills: The ability to talk with individuals and groups about their needs and ask the right questions to surface essential requirements information.  Listening Skills: The ability to understand what people say and to detect what they might be hesitant to say.  Analytical Skills: The ability to critically evaluate the information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information into details, abstract up from low-level information to a more general understanding, distinguish presented user requests from the underlying true needs, and distinguish solution ideas from requirements.  Facilitation Skills: The ability to engage customers and technicians for the purpose of extracting discussion, ideas, opinions, and general contribution in individual settings, meetings, or to lead requirements elicitation workshops.  Observational Skills: The ability to validate data obtained via other techniques and expose new areas for elicitation.  Writing Skills: The ability to communicate information effectively to customers, marketing, managers, and technical staff.  Organizational Skills: The ability to work with a vast array of information gathered during elicitation and analysis and to cope with rapidly changing information and priorities.  Interpersonal Skills: The ability to help negotiate priorities and to resolve conflicts among customers, technologists, and management. Strong teamwork skills at all levels are critical.  Modeling Skills: The ability to represent requirements information in graphical forms that augment textual representations in natural language.  Problem Solving / Reasoning Skills: The ability to balance theory and practical reality in data warehousing methods/approaches.  Productivity Skills: Ability to evaluate, prioritize and problem solve a variety and multiplicity of tasks and ensure their timely and accurate completion. Also, the ability to work independently and take initiative in areas of responsibility.  Industry Knowledge: General knowledge of health care operations desired. Knowledge and appreciation of business concepts and requirements as applicable to a large academic, research, and/or healthcare facility a plus.  Enterprise Information Management / Business Intelligence / Data Warehousing Knowledge: Understands concepts of Data Warehousing applications, tools, functions, and features.  Database Architecture Knowledge: Extensive knowledge of SQL and relational and multi-dimensional database structures and schemas. Visa Candidate Considered: NoCOMPENSATIONDOE Full-time Benefits - Full  Relocation Assistance Available - Possible for ideal candidate  Commission Compensation - No  Bonus Eligible - No  Overtime Eligible - No  Interview Travel Reimbursed - No CANDIDATE DETAILS 5+ to 7 years experience  Seniority Level - Mid-Senior  Management Experience Required - No  Minimum Education - Bachelor's Degree  Willingness to Travel - Occasionally

Name: Technical Business Analyst
Description: BRAND NEW TEAM that has been created within an Enterprise environment. Team size is 6 and this will be the final piece (for the time being).  Amazing work/life balance with flex scheduling - strong bonus and overall compensation package.  We are looking for a technical Business Analyst with an agile mindset, a passion for data and a keen interest in financial markets as we build modern big data platforms to support the data driven digital transformation of our trading businesses. Name: Senior Financial Analyst, Business Support
Description: Looking for a self-driven, motivated individual to serve as the Finance leader supporting a $230M annual Software spend. This role will have direct interaction with Senior Vice President and will be in charge of providing financial governance and decision support for all software sourcing negotiations.  This role partners heavily with the IT leaders and procurement to ensure that the Software strategies are operationally supported and strategically focused to secure the greatest return on investment. This role will drive the financials behind software renewal deals, provide deal modeling and insight. In addition, the role will provide oversight to the forecasting process, recommending trade-offs where necessary, to ensure the $230M annual spend comes in within budget each quarter.  Responsibilities: Leads complex financial analysis for a global business, exercising a strong understanding of the business to determine the best method for achieving objectives.Ensures the accuracy and timeliness of financial reporting and analysis to the business.Actively participate in cross-functional projects designed to solve business problems.Consults with business leaders to drive and influence strategic decision-making within a broad scope (e.g., long-term business planning, product analysis and development, balancing risk, approving significant deals, etc.)Manages external vendors. Education and Experience Required: First level university degree with a focus in business or economics; advanced degree and/or accounting certification (e.g., CPA, MBA) strongly preferred.3-5 years of financial planning and analysis experience with an MBA degree or 8 -10+ years of experience in a finance function with Bachelor's.Goal/results oriented team player with demonstrated success working effectively across different departments.Strong communication and partnership skills with ability to build and convey business insightUnderstanding of accounting processes, procedure and internal controls Knowledge and Skills: Self-driven and ability to work independently.Demonstrate consulting, influence, and negotiation skills.Excellent communication skills, catered to a wide variety of audiences. #LI-KN1Hewlett Packard Enterprise is EEO F/M/Protected Veteran/ Individual with Disabilities. HPE will comply with all applicable laws related to the use of arrest and conviction records, including the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance and similar laws and will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories.

Name: Business Planning Analyst
Description: Defines, manages, and evaluates business plans to ensure they are operationally executable against defined strategic objectives. Leads and partners with cross-functional teams to develop short-term (typically less than two years) business plans and supporting data-driven models.
