Name: Sr. Business Process Analyst
Description: The Sr. Business Process Analyst is responsible for providing business and operation support for Director of Business Process Excellence. The Sr. Business Process Analyst will also assist Airgas Merchant Gases Management and Field personnel with certain business process related activities such as SOPs, plant audit support, order to cash, contract administration, customer master data, pricing, production, maintenance and other ad hoc analyses related to the maintenance and integrity of data in the ERP system (SAP). This will require a seasoned professional that is data savvy and must possess exceptionally strong analytical skills. This position can be physically located in Houston, TX, Independence, OH, or remote (work from home anywhere within the US). ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES  Include the following: Audit and analyze data produced by the field production, distribution, sales, and other operation functions in the SAP and ALTO systems.Develop and use various business reports and metrics to evaluate, interpret, and provide critical information in support of strategic and operating decisions, looking for opportunities to streamline processes and introduce efficiencies while maintaining key controls.Work closely with the Director of Business Process Excellence and other Business Analysts to support field personnel to understand system inputs, processes, and trends; modify, document and train employees on proper processes in the SAP system.Assist in acquisition due diligence and integration as needed.Work with the entire operations team including Maintenance, Distribution and Production Management, Zone Managers, Plant and Terminal personnel, ALTO logistics analysts and Logistics Systems specialists as needed to assure compliance with company policies and procedures at the local level and to evaluate and provide feedback for improvement opportunitiesAssist with field audit activities regarding internal controls, SOP compliance and SOX compliance, as needed.Collaborate across the entire Airgas organization (i.e. Divisions/Regions) and in particular with the other Divisional Business Process Improvement TeamsWork with the BSC to educate finance teams on field operations, controls and SOPsAs needed, participate with order to cash investigations, collaborating with other teams to determine if any process changes are needed to expedite the resolution of customer account problems, and review changes to initiate improvement opportunities throughout the organizationOther duties as assigned. PERSONAL CHARACTERISTICS Strong organizational, team-building, and communication skills. The ability to work and navigate within a complex matrix organization.Able to demonstrate strong leadership skills and the ability to assume increasing responsibilities in a rapidly-changing environment.This position must be able to build effective relationships with all levels and roles in the organization.To be successful, the Sr. Business Process Analyst should possess exceptionally strong analytical skills and a thorough understanding of how to leverage a wide variety of data and related computer tools to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of the organization.The successful candidate must demonstrate the leadership skills required to drive continuous improvement of processes. EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE Bachelor’s degree in finance or in related field.Extensive Airgas experience in operations, distribution, SAP, project management, and process improvement may be considered in lieu of Degree, with the understanding that some college courses may be required in order to provide financial education backgroundFive-plus years’ experience in business process analysis in positions of increasing responsibility.Lean and Six Sigma experience a plus.Advanced working knowledge/usage of MS Word and Excel - experience with SAP and Business Explorer required.Ability to learn Google Platform (Email, Docs, Sheets, Slides, Forms)Experience in working with different departments and cross-functional teams, including people development skills and leadership qualities.Ability to manage multiple priorities and juggle between upper and local management and demands. TRAVEL Up to 25". Short periods of up to 50& can be required. EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability  Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or disability

Name: Business Systems Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionShaw Systems is a national software development company that has an established record of solid financial performance and an excellent reputation for providing quality products. We are seeking a motivated individual to work as a Business Systems Analyst with our credit-based financial software products that run on multiple platforms. This position will be responsible for providing technical product support to clients, as well as troubleshooting software application issues. The ideal candidate will have at least 3 years of experience supporting customers in the banking, lending, leasing, collections or recovery software or a similar industry. Operational experience in the banking or the auto finance industry is a huge plus! Responsibilities:Has a strong understanding of the business application(s) and works with higher level staff or technical support to understand and resolve complex application software problemsAble to do the research and testing that is necessary to answer basic customer inquiresAnalyze and document client needs and business processesAble to manage multiple tasks concurrently when priorities are providedResponsible for communicating directly to customers on progress of issuesResponsible for testing system enhancements and assisting clients with implementing new business featuresAbility to work in a supporting role as team environment with developers, testers and designersStrong experience with requirements gathering and writing specs.Requirements:Bachelor’s degree required or four years of related work experience may substitute for bachelor’s degreeStrong analytical, interpersonal, communication, problem solving and research skillsExcellent written and oral communications skillsProficiency with Microsoft Office products (Word, Excel, Outlook)Understanding of software systems from the user’s and technical perspectiveMinimum 5 years of experience in customer support in banking/lending software or similar industryMust work well under pressure to meet ongoing and overlapping deadlines within short time constraintsAdditional hours may be needed during peak times and for software releasesPrior experience with Structured Query Language (SQL) and relational databases a plusFormal presentation experience a plus**Shaw Systems is an equal opportunity, affirmative action employer**Company DescriptionShaw Systems has specialized in loan servicing software since 1967. We have led the way with financial software, managing the lending process for businesses and providing quality products. We offer complete solutions for loan and lease servicing, and collections and recovery management. Top financial institutions all over the world, including a large number of auto finance leaders, have benefited from using our products.  Shaw Systems realizes the importance of each and every team member; your success is our success. Competitive compensation and opportunities for career growth are key factors in providing a work environment that promotes creativity. We cultivate an environment that promotes collaboration and fun. It seems to be effective: the average tenure of our employees is approaching an unbelievable 17 years!

Name: Senior HRSS Business Analyst

FAST CAR, HR Apex, New BU creation, etc.) by providing business context for HRSS initiatives and support change management and communications to ensure implementations are successfully executedHRSS focal point and liaison for Oracle HCM/HR Service Now changes/enhancements (ie. set ups, new fields, new locations, new jobs codes, etc.) and to coordinate UAT testingAttend RFC meetings with IT to review and close HRIT tickets opened by HRAttend weekly RAIL meetings to identify HRSS assistance required for new projects/contractsReview HR enhancement log with HRSS Team to identify status and priority Job Requirements  Position Specific Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities  To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. 8-10 years diverse experience working on HR related operational projects, preferably globalStrong MS Office knowledge preferredKnowledge of HR Service Now and Oracle HCM preferredStrong communication skills to deal with all levels of the organization and handling issue resolutionsProven process and project management skills, including attention to detail and a demonstrated ability to manage multiple projects and tasks Physical Demands  The physical demands must be met by an employee to successfully perform essential functions of this job. The employee frequently is required to walk, stoop, kneel, carry, push/pull and use repetitive wrist and hand movements. The employee may be required to lift and/or move objects of up to 25 pounds. Name: Business Intelligence Analyst- Sales
Description: ORGANIZATION SUMMARY Weatherford is one of the largest multinational oilfield service companies providing innovative solutions, technology and services to the oil and gas industry. The Company operates in over 90 countries and has a network of approximately 1,000 locations, including manufacturing, service, research and development, and training facilities and employs approximately 29,500 people. For more information, visitwww.weatherford.comand connect with Weatherford onLinkedIn,Twitter,YouTubeandFacebook.  Weatherford delivers innovative technologies and services designed to meet the world?s current and future energy needs in a safe, ethical, and sustainable manner. Grounded by our core values and inspired by our world-class people, we are committed to being a trusted business partner to those we serve. JOB DESCRIPTION Supports the sales and marketing effort through the collection, analysis and reporting of sales and marketing data. Drives and supports the use of Salesforce; supports with the compilation and submission of tenders, compiles and circulates weekly and monthly reports. Assists in the development and implementation of business intelligence tools and solutions. Analyzes and reports on historical and future trends in performance, return and depreciation. Provides commercial and sales oversight, leadership and support to the sales team. DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES: Manage and synthesize external and internal sales data in order to develop and/or make decisions on business strategy. Prepare and report results of analysis and present as needed.  Provide information and analysis to management to be used in management decision making.  Create and manage a knowledge management system for all customer and market information to be shared effectively across the business unit group and business development team.  Prepare briefing and presentation material for management to support their Product Line performance with management.  Ensure that market intelligence from external sources is being effectively archived and utilized and that it meets the unique needs of Management, and where appropriate Product Lines (PL?s) and Regions.  Provide support in the identification, analysis, design, planning and implementation of business process improvement initiatives.  Developing Forecasting and Variance Explanations.  Must understand and comply with all safety rules and company policies of Weatherford.  Know and understand Weatherford SRO Quality Policy and comply with all requirements of the Quality Systems Manual, Operating and Technical Procedures and Workplace Instructions.  Perform various other duties and activities as assigned by supervisor within the physical constraints of the job.  Provide support to Account Managers and Strategic Account Managers in analysis, planning and implementation of pricing improvement action plans. QUALIFICATIONS Must be able to coordinate, prioritize and meet multiple deadlines in demanding environment  Degree in Engineering/Accounting / Finance  Superior analytical and problem solving skills  Ability to communicate information of a complex nature to various levels of management and external clients (written & verbal) in an easy to understand business language  Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel, Access and other MS office software  Ability to respond to an emergency situation. Preferred: Ability to understand the impact of moderately complex changes, formulate test/plans conditions to minimize risks and recommend appropriate business and system solutions  Technical, project management and organizational skills  Possess strong data management technical understanding POSITION SPECIFIC DETAILS Weatherford offers competitive compensation and benefits upon hire; including paid vacation to start, matching 401K program, comprehensive benefits program, and employee stock purchase program (ESPP) and opportunities for on-going training and career development. VEVRAA Federal Contractor ? Priority Referral Requested  Weatherford is an Equal Opportunity Employer Females/ Minorities/ Veterans/Disabled and gives consideration for employment to qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status. REQNUMBER: 75188-1A

Name: Business Data Analyst
Description: Job Summary/Primary Focus The Business Data Analyst interfaces with internal and external sources for purchase and sales data including accounts payable/receivable departments, accounting and finance, Microsoft Dynamics AX and various internal SQL Server databases at Direct Energy North America Home to develop business intelligence for the BuyMax business’ Rebate Division and Private Brands Division who serves Company owned locations, franchisees and other group buying members. The Business Data Analyst is responsible for creating dashboards and reporting methodology to track purchases, produces purchasing history and forecasting reports, pricing analytics for internal customers such as senior management, finance and rebate administration.  Developing and managing data import, extraction and reporting processes from multiple internal and external systems to develop a sourcing data warehouse and developing spend analytics from existing ERP systems are the key responsibilities for this role. We also help our customers save on their energy bills through energy efficiency. Located in over 50 locations, our team of 6,000+ employees serve over 6 million residential and commercial customer relationships.  Direct Energy is a subsidiary of Centrica plc (LSE:CNA), one of the world's leading integrated energy companies with over 20 million customers and 34,000 employees worldwide. We are committed to being the most recommended energy and services provider and leading the transition to a low carbon society. Name: Technical Business Analyst
Description: Job Description IBM HR is undergoing a huge transformation and we are looking for a Technical Business Analyst to join our Technology Transformation Team.  The team is driving innovation by bringing in best in class software systems as well as overseeing the build of innovative Watson powered AI solutions. The technology we bring are focused on enabling the talent, executive, and learning teams. Our goal is to have the highest performing workforce with the best skills aligned to the right roles at the right time.  You enjoy solving the toughest challenges and roadblocks and can also take responsibility independently. You work well under pressure and are able to keep deadlines in a changing working environment.  We are looking for a Technical Business Analyst to work with the business to help understand, and translate business needs into high level and granular technical requirements. The selected candidate will help facilitate build buy evaluations in partnership with the project management and product management team.  Work Location  Littleton OR Cambridge OR Raleigh  Required Technical and Professional Expertise 3+ years of experience creating and gathering requirements for enterprise level projects1+ year of experience supporting a software engineering team. Preferred Tech and Prof Experience Work closely with Product Manager, project manager, development organization and third party vendors.Create Business Definition or Business Requirements Document and Use CasesUtilize design thinking skills to help the business arrive at their desired requirements.Critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources and distinguish user requests from the underlying true needsSuccessfully engage in multiple initiatives simultaneouslyStrong analytical skills including a thorough understanding of how to interpret customer business needs and translate them into application and operational requirements EO Statement  IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

Name: Business Application Analyst
Description: Job SummaryWe are searching for a Business Application Analyst – someone who works well in a fast-paced managed care setting. In this position, you’ll be responsible for understanding the business and business requirements in relation to applications, reporting, and processes of our Health Plan. You will be working with the business to clarify requests and interpret needs. Lastly, this position includes significant or complex system configuration, report design, data analysis and issues resolution.Ideally we are looking for a business analyst with strong skills and two to five years of experience. You are going to gather requirements from clients and help them directly or assign resources that will solve their requests for needs. Experience with SQL, health care, MS Team, and Agile methodology will be helpful but not required. If you are great at handling support issues and gathering requirements that’s where we need you most.　This role will be based in our Health Plan location which is at 610 and Bellaire Boulevard just south of the Galleria.Think you’ve got what it takes?HOU123 ResponsibilitiesAssists in design of user workflowsSupports business staff with application questions and issuesSupports external users with setup and application errors related to business applicationsMonitors error logs and reports and researches errors resolving issues where possibleSupports business staff with application questions and issuesSupports external users with setup and application errors related to business applicationsEvaluates business procedures and problems for process improvementSupports projects, application installation, and quality assurancePerforms business, configuration, and process analysis and identifies improvementsDevelops and implements yearly quality and service level objectives to enhance IS services and value, adjusting as needed, as evidenced by quarterly reporting Qualifications4 years of experience in information systems or a bachelor’s degree in computer science, business administration, or health care administration High school diploma or GEDPrevious experience in a hospital settingKnowledge of technical and business analysisKnowledge of Microsoft technologies, troubleshooting application issues and errors with SQL Server experienceKnowledge of the health care industry in general and the health insurance environment specifically is preferredFamiliarity with a variety of hardware and software environmentsKnowledge of T-SQL and database designsAbility to develop and run T-SQL basic queriesAbility to apply application analyst techniquesProcess mapping abilityAbility to perform troubleshooting and recommend appropriate actionAbility to apply application analyst techniques Company ProfileThe Texas Children’s Hospital system is the largest pediatric integrated care system, and is an industry leader in pediatric population health. Founded in 1996, Texas Children’s Health Plan is the nation's first health maintenance organization (HMO) created just for children and pregnant women. We are an Integrated Community System providing holistic care that empowers families to live healthier lives. Texas Children's Health Plan is also the largest combined STAR/CHIP Managed Care Organization in the Harris County service area. Currently, the Health Plan serves more than 450,000 members across three state territories (Harris, Jefferson, North East), who receive care from our network of more than 1,100 primary care physicians, 3,200 specialists, and 70 hospitals.To join our community of 13,000 dedicated team members, visit www.texaschildrenspeople.org for career opportunities.You can also learn more about our amazing culture at www.infinitepassion.org

Name: Senior Business Analyst
Description: Who are we? Watch to find out!Do you have a long-term vision for your career? Are you looking for your next career opportunity at a pioneering and entrepreneurial company? At Koch, 90% of earnings are reinvested in the company so that we can create opportunities and long-term value for our customers, employees, and society. Our culture is defined by the Market-Based Management® philosophy which guides everyday decision making and provides employees with opportunities to contribute and personally benefit from the value they create.Koch Ag & Energy Solutions is seeking a Sr. Business Analyst to join our team in Houston, TX. The KAES Business Analyst is an IT Professional who will understand the priority of the business and lead projects to improve capabilities, eliminate waste, and capture additional revenue opportunities. We are an equal opportunity employer. Minority/Female/Disabled/VeteranExcept where prohibited by state law, all offers of employment are conditioned upon successfully passing a drug test.  This employer uses E-Verify. Please visit the following website for additional information: www.kochcareers.com/doc/Everify.pdfFollow us

Name: IT Business Analyst/qa Tester
Description: We are looking for an IT Business Analyst/QA Tester to collect and analyze requirements, document, and test software applications and systems.  The selected candidate for this role will  Serve as the liaison between stakeholders and the development team.  Meet with stakeholders to collect, analyze, and document their business requirements, processes, and system goals.  Document existing software, database systems, and processes.  Create functional and non-functional requirements, Organizationels, use cases, process flows, diagrams and charts, and other documentation to provide direction to developers.  Analyze/research user requests for possible changes or defects.  Ensure developed solutions meet customer needs.  Develop test plans, test cases, and test data based on requirements.  Design and maintain automation test scripts.  Perform production verification to ensure production implementations are functioning properly.  Perform other duties as required. Qualifications Required Education/Experience/Skills  This position is posted at multiple levels. Depending on the candidate’s experience, requirements and business needs, we reserve the right to consider candidates at any level for which this position has been advertised.  BS degree in a computer or system science discipline from an accredited college or university and a minimum of ten (10) years of progressive, relevant experience, or a MS degree in a computer or system science discipline from an accredited college or university and a minimum of eight (8) years of progressive experience, or a Ph.D. degree in a computer or system science discipline from an accredited college or university and a minimum of four (4) years of progressive experience. Requires demonstrated and recognized technical expertise in specialty areas of engineering system design and analysis.  Must have experience gathering requirements for software/systems, and translating those requirement accurately to the software development team.  Must have an understanding of industry best practice requirements definition and system testing concepts.  Strong understanding of the full lifecycle (SDLC) with Agile/Scrum experience.  Strong understanding of web-based applications.  Experience in Microsoft SQL.  Familiar with Microsoft Office products.  Self-motivated, team player, and adaptable to a dynamic environment and the ability to complete all assignments as required.  Excellent oral and written communication skills.  Good problem solving skills.  Must have good time management skills and be able to handle multiple projects simultaneously.  Preferences  Experience with test automation programs such as Selenium or similar applications.  SharePoint knowledge.

Name: IT Business Analyst - SCMH
Description: For 75 years, Southern California Material Handling (SCMH) headquartered in California has stood for quality and service excellence. It remains an industry leader in providing top-brand solutions to clients across Southern California.Known for its strong portfolio of factory-direct powered industrial trucks—Caterpillar, Mitsubishi, Jungheinrich, Kalmar, Columbia, Genie, Bendi, Drexel, Noble, and Sellick—SCMH is equipped to deliver cost-effective solutions found most advantageous by its customers. SCMH’s extensive inventory of lift trucks is highly complemented by the wide range of parts, maintenance and repair services, comprehensive warehouse solutions, and OSHA-required training courses, all readily available to respond to its clients’ day-to-day operation needs.Position Summary:The IT Business Analyst defines the requirements and computer solutions to resolve business-related problems, administers control of records and meets strategic organizational goals. The employee serves a role in the selection, implementation and support of new and existing applications. This position includes planning and recommending acquisition of new software applications or devising ways to apply existing system resources to additional operations.Knowledge, Skills and ExperienceTo perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.Required:Associate’s Degree (A.A.) or equivalent from two-year college or technical school; minimum three years related work experience and/or trainingApproximately 3 years of experience in program management and administrative servicesHighly motivated and dedicated individual with a great sense of responsibilityA work ethic of dependability through punctuality, flexibility, and adaptability to perform as an efficient, detail oriented team player.Demonstrated experience with current systems analysis principles, methods, procedures, practices, tools and techniques and project management principles.Proven ability to communicate effectively with displayed levels of knowledge, skills and responsibilities.Ability to prioritize independently, multiple requests and system requirements to meet the organizational goals.Achievement-oriented, excellent computer, communication, analytical and problem solving skills, specializing in program management and process improvementProficiency in Microsoft Office productsFlexible team playerMicrosoft SQL Server Reporting Services experience.T-SQL, database objects and functions familiarityAbility to conduct end user training and produce education materialDesired:Bachelor’s Degree, preferredKnowledge of Equip-SoftAdvanced Microsoft Office skills Microsoft Dynamics NavMicrosoft Dynamics CRM 2011 This company is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, gender, disability or protected veteran status.

Name: FP&A and Business Intelligence Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionThis position offers a unique opportunity for a junior finance professional to join an entrepreneurial organization that is leading the way in finance innovation. For career development, the Analyst / Associate role would be particularly attractive to a candidate looking to expand his/her finance skill set across FP&A and corporate finance. Responsibilities: · Support partner company relationships and execution of client engagements.  · Build-up flexible and granular financial models, perform various financial analyses, deep-dives, sensitivity analyses, and other analyses to drive operational and transactional insights.  · Perform detailed analysis and synthesize actionable insights from data sets and unstructured information sources.  · Conduct financial and business research to assist with various investment and growth decisions.  · Prepare impactful reports and presentations, including marketing materials, information memoranda, investor and/or Board reporting packages, and other presentations as required. Qualifications: · A bachelor's degree in business, finance, accounting, economics, data science, or related field. MBA or CFA a plus but not required.  · 2 years+ in corporate FP&A (transaction experience a plus), private equity, investment banking, finance-related consulting, or other data analysis role.  · Ability to work collaboratively in a team-oriented environment.  · Ability to work independently/remotely with limited oversight in the completion of projects.  · Extreme attention to detail.  · Advanced Excel skills; candidates should describe themselves as one or more of: expert, ninja, guru, whiz kid, etc.  · Experience with BI tools such as Microsoft Power BI a major plus but not required; interest in developing expertise in the Microsoft Power Suite (Pivot/Query/BI) an absolute must.  · Strong PowerPoint and presentation building skills.  · High integrity and individually motivated.  · Some travel required. Additional Details – Financial Modeling: · A strong financial modeling skill set is integral to the position, with a preference for knowledge/experience in: three-statement financial analysis, corporate finance/capitalization analysis, budgeting/forecasting, reporting/KPI dashboard templates, financial projections, working capital analysis, profitability/performance analysis, and manipulation of non-financial/operational data sets.  · Experience in creating automation analysis templates for recurring financial management processes (e.g. rolling forecasts, ongoing reporting templates) is a plus; not required, but must be an area of interest.  · A financial modeling assessment will be conducted as part of the interview process.  · Candidates without a background in finance will be considered with strong data analysis skills and an ability to quickly get up the curve in core finance concepts.Company DescriptionFirst Water (www.firstwateradvisors.com) is a Relational Finance firm providing one-stop-shop finance access to small and midsize businesses (SMBs) and private equity portfolio companies. We offer our services across four verticals that can be deployed individually or holistically in building long-term partner company relationships. These verticals include:  FiRe Score – Finance Function and Growth/Capital Roadmap Assessments, including our free quiz available at www.fire-score.com  Root Source – Data, Reporting, and Business Intelligence Solutions  Tail Wind – Budgeting and Forecasting Management and Improvement  Life Blood – Capital Raising, M&A, and Transaction Advisory  With backgrounds spanning private equity, financial planning and analysis (FP&A), investment banking, commercial lending, consulting, and small business management, First Water provides expertise and managed solutions typically not staffed in-house or have traditionally been available only via an upfront or immediate transaction catalyst. By un-tethering these skills from traditional models and making them available to smaller businesses earlier in their growth phase, First Water partner companies harness their data, build future visibility, craft attractive narratives to capital, and execute on planned and opportunistic transactions.

Preferred Engineering UndergraduateWe are looking for visionaries who are ready to make an impact on the way the world works. At HP, the future is yours to create. Thanks for taking the time to review our job, if you think it is a match to your knowledge and interests please apply today we are eager to learn more about you.

Name: Lead Business Analyst
Description: SUMMARY The Lead Business Analyst acts as a facilitator and liaison across functional teams and ANSYS IT for all aspects of the development of functional roadmaps that include People, Process and Technology changes. This role aligns strategic goals and objectives with decisions regarding the alignment of capabilities and corresponding investments in key initiatives. The role will partner with the PMO, Application and Functional teams to drive the development of initiative roadmaps. The primary focus is the business motivations, business operations and business analysis frameworks that link these aspects of an enterprise together. Name: Business Systems Analyst & Data Integrator
Description: Business Systems Analyst and Data Integrator Oil and gas Exploration and Production Description: The Business Systems Analyst Data Integrator is the primary source of process information and interface to application and respective data for functional business customers. This analyst is essential in supporting the enterprise Data Stores and Data Marts for each functional. This analyst is knowledgeable in both business processes and systems that support one or more related business functions in the Oil and Gas industry. This person is integral in the promotion and adoption of visualization and business intelligence techniques and applications. Responsibilities: Review and analyze the accuracy and efficiency of existing business processes, systems and technologies used in/for business areas and develop strategies for improving or leveraging these systems.  Assess and recommend strategic direction with regard to data utilities, business intelligence applications and reporting tools to support the enterprise.  Identify the need for interfaces and integration between application repositories to improve data sharing and analysis for business decisions.  Ensure that any new software integration meets functional/end user requirements, compliant to interface specifications.  Design and develop identified interfaces/integrations using appropriate tools and create or review technical design documentation to ensure the accurate deployment of solutions.  Monitor and assess effectiveness and performance of data movement from application repositories to Operational Data Stores and Data marts used for data visualization and reporting by all functional areas of the enterprise.  Monitor and maintain integrity of operational data in several SQL databases that comprise the companys Data Store and Data Marts.  Promote adoption of appropriate utilities and applications for business users that provide productivity enhancements and more accurate and timely business decisions.  Design, develop and implement ETL processes to transform structured, unstructured and disparate source data into the target data store(s)/ data warehouse(s) / data mart(s).  Provide technical assistance and cross training to IT team members and business users.  Define functional and system requirements accordingly.  Assist the Business with development of effective test scenarios, scripts, and use cases with consideration to cross-functional process impact.  Analyze formal test results in order to discover and resolve defects, bugs, errors, configuration and interoperability flaws. Desired Skills:  Excellent knowledge of Oil and Gas functions and processes.  Ability to effectively translate between functional and technical teams.  3+ years experience implementing enterprise-scale data systems, including:  Working with users in a requirements analysis role  Extensive use of SQL and RDBMS systems (SQL Server Oracle, etc.)  Extensive experience with data warehouse implementations  Strong knowledge of logical and physical data modeling concepts  Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment.  Proficiency with SQL Server database utilities and admin tools. Performance tuning experience required.  Demonstrated ability with ETL tools. Familiarity with Informatica is a plus.  Proficiency with SQL for data query, data manipulation (insert, update and delete), data definition (schema creation and modification), and data access control.  Strong analytical, conceptual and problem-solving abilities.  Excellent interpersonal (verbal and written) communication skills are required to support working in project environments that includes internal, external and customer teams.  Programming / scripting experience and knowledge of software development life cycle is preferred.  Proficiency in Microsoft utilities; specifically SSIS, SSRS and SSAS.  Experience designing and developing Reports.  Highly self-motivated, self-directed, and attentive to detail.

Name: ERP Business Analyst ( PeopleSoft HRMS)
Description: Job DescriptionERP Business Analyst III ensures that the operational interests of their respective functional areas are being fully represented in the day-to-day operations of the Information Technology Department. This role supports several applications deployed within the Harris Health System , including PeopleSoft Human Resources (HCM), Financials (FS) and Supply Chain (SCM) Kronos Workforce Timekeeping and Advanced Scheduling MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS: Education/Specialized Training/Licensure: Bachelors Degree in Computer Science or related degree, or four (4) years of related IT work experience in lieu of a degree. Work Experience (Years and Area): 5 Years within Information System (I.S.). At least three (3) years PeopleSoft, Kronos experience. SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS:Communication Skills: Above Average Verbal (Heavy Public Contact)  Exceptional Verbal (e.g., Public Speaking)  Bilingual Skills Required No  Writing /Composing Yes (Correspondence Yes/ Reports Yes) Other Skills: Analytical, Design, Research, Statistical Advanced Education: Bachelors Degree Major: Computer Science or Related  Work Schedule: On Call Other Requirements:Understands functional processes and business rules related to the applications being implemented/supported.Understands the limitations and opportunities presented by the applications supported.Understands how application layer security is assigned and works.Demonstrates adaptability and flexibility in the face of changing demands.Ability to exceed customer expectation, quality, and productivity.Provide production support for the ERP applications, including participation in a 24×7 on-call support rotation.Participate in production changes that may occur after 5:00p.m. or on weekends Company DescriptionHarris Health is a nationally recognized health system comprising three teaching hospitals and an extensive network of ambulatory care centers serving the people of Harris County, Texas, since 1966. Staffed by the faculty, fellows and residents from two nationally ranked medical schools, Baylor College of Medicine and The University of Texas Health Science Center at Houston (UTHealth), Harris Health is the first healthcare system in Houston to receive the prestigious National Committee for Quality Assurance (NCQA) designation for its network of patient-centered medical homes.  Each year, Harris Health provides more than 1.8 million total outpatient visits through its more than 40 ambulatory care facilities. Additionally, Harris Health sees more than 177,000 emergency visits at its Level 1 and Level 3 trauma centers and 35,000 hospital admissions through its three hospitals: Ben Taub, LBJ and Quentin Mease.  Established by voter referendum to enhance the level of charity care available in the community, Harris Health System has often received national recognition for serving those in need and for its achievements in operational excellence, such as being named to the 2011, 2012, 2013 and 2014 Most Wired Hospitals lists by the American Hospital Association’s Hospitals & Health Networks magazine.  Additionally, Harris Health System is pleased that each of its three hospitals — Ben Taub, Lyndon B. Johnson and Quentin Mease — achieved Pathway to ExcellenceTM designation by the American Nurses Credentialing Center.  Harris Health System benefits program is designed to provide you with more flexibility and choices in meeting your specific needs. Harris Health System benefits program allows you to protect your income in case of illness, death and disability, and to help you save for retirement.  It is the policy of Harris Health System to provide equal opportunity for all applicants for employment regardless political affiliation, race, color, national origin, age, sex, religious creed or disability. Applicants may request any reasonable accommodation(s) to participate in the application process.

Name: Business Analyst - HOU
Description: What is a CTRM Consultant? Fortune 500 companies will look to you and your team to help solve various complex problems around commodity trading. You will help major companies streamline their commodity trading operations by finding innovative solutions to problems with their business processes. Maximize your problem solving skills through exposure to a variety projects and their different aspects. Once you learn the technical systems and have a healthy overall business knowledge around CTRM, then you can choose the career path as a Software Implementation consultant/Technical Consultant (writing the code for implementations, upgrades & enhancements), Business Analyst/functional consultant (gathering requirements & making sure that the project will perfectly fit the end goal business needs of our clients), or become a hybrid consultant who enjoys both. About You Bachelors degree or higher in Computer/Mechanical/Industrial/Chemical Engineering, Computer Science, Information Technology or equivalent with minimum overall GPA of 3.3 The ability to work with and provide input on a collaborative team while accepting other ideas with an open mind · Personal drive to work in a self-motivated, self-directed fashion · Exceptional verbal and written communication skills, and the ability to explain complex concepts to a non-technical audience, due to this being a client-facing role · Ability to travel Monday Thursday (weekly) The ability to analyze and translate large datasets An understanding of application development (C#, Java and/or SQL are a plus) MS Excel and modeling experience are a plus Provided Training If you possess the core competencies that make a great consultant for our team, then we will spend the first few weeks surrounding you with seasoned senior consultants who are experts in the industry to train you on everything from energy commodities to CTRM solution delivery. It is our goal to make sure that everyone on our team is the best in the industry. capSpire expects our future hires to continue with this passion of collaborating with and enabling those around them to be successful.  About Us capSpire is in the process of growing our consulting team and places extreme value on the quality of our team. We are looking for self-motivated individuals to be apart of a global system integration and technology firm driven by our passion to create meaningful solutions for our clients. Take on new challenges in a collaborative environment where great minds come together to solve tough problems and challenge each other to create innovative solutions for our clients in the Commodity Trading Risk Management industry. capSpire provides the ability to maximize employee growth according to your relentless problem solving and team effort. If you have a passion for technology and enjoy working with likeminded and intelligent team members with deep industry experience, then capSpire might be the perfect fit for you.

Name: Business Process Analyst II

We are looking for smart, team oriented people who want to be part of a first-class workforce that gives people the tools they need to meet their financial goals, all while delivering an outstanding client experience. Learn more below.**Responsibilities****General Summary:**Working independently or as part of a team, Business Process Analysts will analyze processes, identify areas of opportunity, define projects to improve performance and drive those projects to completion. Name: Personal Systems Business Analyst Intern (MBA)
Description: About Us Innovation is in HPs DNA. From our origins in a Palo Alto garage in 1939, to our current position as one of the worlds leading technology companies, HP has grown to become a leader in technology and corporate culture, inspiring innovators and entrepreneurs around the globe.  HP brings together a portfolio that spans printing, personal computing, software and services to serve more than 1 billion customers in over 170 countries. We are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace that attracts exceptional talent and to supporting our employees to succeed at all levels. We dream in over 35 languages and share one mission: to engineer experiences that amaze.  Personal Systems Services is one of the fastest-growing and highly profitable businesses within HP and a key pillar of our company's future. The WW Strategy and Insights organization is looking for a highly motivated strong performer to support us in designing, planning and executing the long-term transformation of our Services business.  Join us for a 12-week paid summer internship designed to let you apply your classroom learnings to real world challenges. Our internships have a thoughtful balance of networking, executive speakers, community involvement, big meaty projects (no paper filing here!) and fun! About You · Business Acumen. You have sharp business judgment and the ability to see past the noise in large datasets to summarize and present actionable insights.  · Aspiring Analytics Guru. You dream in Excel and have experience with data visualization tools.  · Creative Problem Solver. You have a creative approach in developing actionable analysis and recommendations  · Communicate persuasively. You use data-based decision making to present ideas.  · Excellent analytical thinking, analysis, and problem-solving skills.  · Ability to take strategic concepts and translate then into operational plans and financial models.  · Excellent project management skills, including project structuring and managing multiple work streams independently. Responsibilities As a Business Analyst Intern, within our Personal Systems Services business, you will:  · Manage complex data and business analyses to develop business plans and make recommendations that drive strategic decisions.  · Develop dashboards to empower other team members with data.  · Construct statistical and financial models to forecast business performance.  · Perform creative analysis to develop insights into complex questions.  · Define the metrics required to measure business performance.  · Develop go-forward business plan recommendations based on potential risks and returns.  · Identify cutting-edge analytical tools, models, and methods for making key business decisions.  Key areas of support will include:  · Strategy Framework and Execution Plans to deliver on strategy  · Financial Modeling/Projections of different strategic business initiatives  · Long-term planning process  · Annual budget interlock process  · Strategic investigations business model, cost structure, benchmarking, RTM efficiency, M&A targets, etc. including internal consulting to WW, region and country teams as needed. Education · MBA students with 1st year completed, coursework related to Technology, Leadership, Management.  We are looking for visionaries who are ready to make an impact on the way the world works. At HP, the future is yours to create. Thanks for taking the time to review our job, if you think it is a match to your knowledge and interests please apply today we are eager to learn more about you.

Name: Business Data Analyst
Description: Job Summary/Primary Focus The Business Data Analyst interfaces with internal and external sources for purchase and sales data including accounts payable/receivable departments, accounting and finance, Microsoft Dynamics AX and various internal SQL Server databases at Direct Energy North America Home to develop business intelligence for the BuyMax business’ Rebate Division and Private Brands Division who serves Company owned locations, franchisees and other group buying members. The Business Data Analyst is responsible for creating dashboards and reporting methodology to track purchases, produces purchasing history and forecasting reports, pricing analytics for internal customers such as senior management, finance and rebate administration.  Developing and managing data import, extraction and reporting processes from multiple internal and external systems to develop a sourcing data warehouse and developing spend analytics from existing ERP systems are the key responsibilities for this role. This position will drive client engagement in our programs and increase our share of their purchases. Located in over 50 locations, our team of 6,000+ employees serve over 6 million residential and commercial customer relationships. The technology we bring are focused on enabling the talent, executive, and learning teams. Our goal is to have the highest performing workforce with the best skills aligned to the right roles at the right time.  You enjoy solving the toughest challenges and roadblocks and can also take responsibility independently. Name: Business Process Analyst |
Description: Position DescriptionUnder moderate supervision, the Business Process Analyst will research, analyze, document, test, train, support and implement business information systems and processes for County Criminal Courts at Law, County Civil Courts at Law, Harris County Justice Courts and the Criminal Law Hearing Officers. Provides technical assistance, training, and Help Desk support relative to the operation of Windows, MS Office, JWEB, Odyssey, and JIMS.  Duties, Functions and Responsibilities:Analyzes business processes and requirements to identify requirements for case management system transactions. Conducts feasibility studies and performs a cost-benefit analysis to determine viable solutions for business processes improvement needs. Interfaces with the business and technical units of the Office of Court Management and County Agencies and Departments. Researches current technology related to court business practices. Conducts on-site assessment of technology and processes. Applies specialized technical knowledge to improve business processes through technology applications. Manages case information systems projects, technical support activities, and network and business operations and communicate the activity status to customers and management. Makes recommendations for the purchase, installation, and implementing of software applications and hardware. Develops and delivers professional development including curriculum materials and classroom activities. Analyzes and develops court management reports. Analyzes information technology projects according to current methodology. Researches and reports solutions to business problems. Researches, defines, and coordinates the implementation of best practices (processes and methodologies). Models and documents processes and technical designs at levels of detail required for varied audiences, e.g. business stakeholders, developers, other technical staff. Develops use cases and use case diagrams. Develops business process and data flow diagrams.Supervisor and/or Leadership Responsibilities:May provide leadership and/or guidance to others on projects, evaluation, and training. Maintains awareness of developments in court administration.  Requirements Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Political Science, Public or Business Administration or related field andTwo (2) years of experience with court business operations or systems development.ORAssociate's degree in Computer Science, Political Science, Public or Business Administration or related field andFour (4) years of experience with court business operations or systems development.OR High school diploma or G.E.D. andSix (6) years of experience with court business operations or systems development.PLUSExperience with Odyssey software.  NOTE: To qualify for this position, required experience, education and skills must be clearly stated on your application's employment history. Resumes are welcome, but we do not use any information provided on your resume to qualify and refer you to the Hiring Department for consideration. Experience obtained while on the military must also be included as part of your employment history on the application.Preferences Experience with JIMS and JWEB. General InformationHOURS:Monday – Friday / 8:00 a.m. – 5:00 p.m. SALARY:Commensurate with Experience Based on 26 Pay Periods

Name: Business Application Analyst
Description: Job SummaryWe are searching for a Business Application Analyst – someone who works well in a fast-paced managed care setting. In this position, you’ll be responsible for understanding the business and business requirements in relation to applications, reporting, and processes of our Health Plan. You will be working with the business to clarify requests and interpret needs. Lastly, this position includes significant or complex system configuration, report design, data analysis and issues resolution.Ideally we are looking for a business analyst with strong skills and two to five years of experience. You are going to gather requirements from clients and help them directly or assign resources that will solve their requests for needs. Experience with SQL, health care, MS Team, and Agile methodology will be helpful but not required. If you are great at handling support issues and gathering requirements that’s where we need you most.　This role will be based in our Health Plan location which is at 610 and Bellaire Boulevard just south of the Galleria.Think you’ve got what it takes?HOU123 ResponsibilitiesAssists in design of user workflowsSupports business staff with application questions and issuesSupports external users with setup and application errors related to business applicationsMonitors error logs and reports and researches errors resolving issues where possibleSupports business staff with application questions and services and value, adjusting as needed, as evidenced by quarterly reporting Qualifications4 years of experience in information systems or a bachelor’s degree in computer science, business administration, or health care administration High school diploma or GEDPrevious experience in a hospital settingKnowledge of technical and business analysisKnowledge of Microsoft technologies, troubleshooting application issues and errors with SQL Server experienceKnowledge of the health care industry in general and the health insurance environment specifically is preferredFamiliarity with a variety of hardware and software environmentsKnowledge of T-SQL and database designsAbility to develop and run T-SQL basic queriesAbility to apply application analyst techniquesProcess mapping abilityAbility to perform troubleshooting and recommend appropriate actionAbility to apply application analyst techniques Company ProfileThe Texas Children’s Hospital system is the largest pediatric integrated care system, and is an industry leader in pediatric population health. Founded in 1996, Texas Children’s Health Plan is the nation's first health maintenance organization (HMO) created just for children and pregnant women. We are an Integrated Community System providing holistic care that empowers families to live healthier lives. Texas Children's Health Plan is also the largest combined STAR/CHIP Managed Care Organization in the Harris County service area. Currently, the Health Plan serves more than 450,000 members across three state territories (Harris, Jefferson, North East), who receive care from our network of more than 1,100 primary care physicians, 3,200 specialists, and 70 hospitals.To join our community of 13,000 dedicated team members, visit www.texaschildrenspeople.org for career opportunities.You can also learn more about our amazing culture at www.infinitepassion.org

Name: IT Business Systems Analyst - Store Systems
Description: IT Business Systems Analyst - Store SystemsCOMPANY Charming Charlie is a one-of-a-kind source of style that's been inspiring women to live more colorfully since 2004. Known for offering a wide array of women’s apparel and fashion accessories, beauty, gifts and more, all ingeniously arranged by color; making that perfect look fun and easy to find. We believe that when it comes to fashion, if it feels good, do it, and if it looks good, do it in every color it comes in! Winner of several awards, Charming Charlie is recognized for leading a retail revolution with an awe-inspiring in-store experience of carefully-curated collections, featuring breathtaking volumes of color and something special for every occasion. From the big days to the everyday, Charming Charlie celebrates women and the colorful lives they lead. It’s a place where she can bond with her best friends, find unique gifts and discover new treasures that surprise and delight. With over 260 stores in the United States Charming Charlie continues to spread color and style from coast to coast with irresistibly affordable fashions that keep women coming back again and again. SUMMARY Charming Charlie, an award-winning fashion jewelry and accessories retailer, is actively seeking a Business Systems Analyst with experience in designing and implementing business processes and technology to support them. This Information Technology role is responsible for all support related to Point of Sale software and processes (Aptos POS), Sales Audit, Customer Relationship Management (CRM), Pricing & Promotions management. The ideal candidate would be familiar with retail processes, and possess excellent communication skills, the ability to prioritize and problem solve in a fast paced environment, and excellent organization skills. This candidate must also be comfortable working with technology, configuring applications, generating reports, and transferring files between systems. The Business Systems Analyst works closely with stakeholders to develop best practices to design, test, implement, support new systems and processes to ensure they meet business objectives. KEY JOB RESPONSIBILTIESServe as key resource in the analysis, design, testing, implementation and maintenance of the Aptos POS, Sales Audit, CRM and related systemsAct as a subject matter expert of “as-is” and “to-be” business process for the supported business teams, including process mapping, analysis, and redesignIdentify business needs and recommend software/process improvements to address gaps as well as evaluate proposed enhancements from other sourcesCreate and maintain documentation/communication materials for new and existing systems/processesMaintain team knowledge-base, process flows, and related artifactsMaintain relationships with key stakeholders including internal business customers, external vendors, and the rest of Information Technology to understand their needs and prioritiesAssist both 1st and 2nd line support teams with issue investigation when needed, while working to enhance their functional understanding of the systemQUALIFICATIONS5+ years of experience3+ years of IT / Business Analyst or similar experienceSQL knowledge a plusRetail knowledge a plusBS or BA degree in computer science, business administration, or related field is desirableDemonstrated ability to work systematically and logically to analyze situations, identify causes, resolve problems, and anticipate implicationsStrong written and verbal communicationCHARMING CHARLIE PERKSBenefits including Medical, Vision, Dental, 401k (matching after you’ve been with us for a year) just to name a fewPTO and Paid Holidays40% Associate DiscountEvery Friday the Charming Charlie office closes at 3:00 PMCorporate and team-building eventsReporting: Service Delivery Manager, Store Systems FLSA Status: Exempt  Charming Charlie is proud to be an equal employment opportunity employer. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities for all applicants and employees, and comply with all federal, state, and local laws governing non-discrimination and equal opportunity. Equal employment opportunity is a fundamental principle at Charming Charlie, where employment is based upon personal capabilities and qualifications, without regard to race,color, religion, sex, age, national origin, disability, military/veteran status, sexual orientation, sexual or gender identification, genetic information, or other legally protected status. Charming Charlie also prohibits the harassment of any individual on the basis of any legally-protected characteristic including those listed above. ​​

Demonstrated technical leadership skills. #LI-PD1  1016766

Name: IT Business Analyst/qa Tester
Description: We are looking for an IT Business Analyst/QA Tester to collect and analyze requirements, document, and test software applications and systems.  The selected candidate for this role will  Serve as the liaison between stakeholders and the development team.  Meet with stakeholders to collect, analyze, and document their business requirements, processes, and system goals.  Document existing software, database systems, and processes.  Create functional and non-functional requirements, Organizationels, use cases, process flows, diagrams and charts, and other documentation to provide direction to developers.  Analyze/research user requests for possible changes or defects.  Ensure developed solutions meet customer needs.  Develop test plans, test cases, and test data based on requirements.  Design and maintain automation test scripts.  Perform production verification to ensure production implementations are functioning properly.  Perform other duties as required. Qualifications Required Education/Experience/Skills  This position is posted at multiple levels. Depending on the candidate’s experience, requirements and business needs, we reserve the right to consider candidates at any level for which this position has been advertised.  BS degree in a computer or system science discipline from an accredited college or university and a minimum of ten (10) years of progressive, relevant experience, or a MS degree in a computer or system science discipline from an accredited college or university and a minimum of eight (8) years of progressive experience, or a Ph.D. degree in a computer or system science discipline from an accredited college or university and a minimum of four (4) years of progressive experience. Requires demonstrated and recognized technical expertise in specialty areas of engineering system design and analysis.  Must have experience gathering requirements for software/systems, and translating those requirement accurately to the software development team.  Must have an understanding of industry best practice requirements definition and system testing concepts.  Strong understanding of the full lifecycle (SDLC) with Agile/Scrum experience.  Strong understanding of web-based applications.  Experience in Microsoft SQL.  Familiar with Microsoft Office products.  Self-motivated, team player, and adaptable to a dynamic environment and the ability to complete all assignments as required.  Excellent oral and written communication skills.  Good problem solving skills.  Must have good time management skills and be able to handle multiple projects simultaneously.  Preferences  Experience with test automation programs such as Selenium or similar applications.  SharePoint knowledge.

Description: Senior Business Systems Analyst  Houston TX  We are currently accepting applications for a full-time Senior Business systems Analyst. We offer a competitive salary, health insurance, paid PTO, and paid holidays. Our aim is to help you find valuable employment in the area of healthcare. We focus on placing healthcare professionals in their chosen field and focus our placement efforts as a huge responsibility and rewarding profession.  We encourage you to Join Our Team and apply! Upon applying and meeting the qualifications, we will reach out to you and answer any further questions you may have about this opportunity. We are one of the largest workforce solutions firms in the United States, ensuring significant employment opportunities with available positions across the nation. This position will also be responsible for leading and mentoring other junior business analysts as well as working on process improvement for functional and technical analysis. May coordinate or assist in creating models or developing reports.Assists in development of strategies, policies, procedures and standards.Coordination and adherence to functional and technical development, configuration of process standards mandated by either MDACC and provides justification for any deviation.Assists with issue resolution and risk mitigation.Communicates problems / issues that may arise in determining solution feasibility and alternatives to the project manager or manager.Maintains effective relationships with customers, vendors, project team members and management.May design and develop training materials and coordinate training sessions for customers.Provides positive feedback to team members when they make a positive contribution.Lead and mentor other Business Analysts - Takes on a lead role in improvement of business analysis techniquesTake on a lead role in data mapping reviewsTakes on a lead role in developing test plans for different workstreamsDevelop business analysis methodologyAssist manager with business analyst resource allocationMentor and train other junior level Business AnalystsPerforms other duties and projects as assigned by technical lead, project manager, and/or manager. D. Anderson or three years of equivalent scope and role in other healthcare institution or industry preferred.Big Data experience preferred but not requiredExperience in data warehousing and business intelligenceExperience working in and a well-rounded knowledge of the M.D. Anderson IT environment.Experience in health care environment (hospitals, or drugs not insurance companies) We support a diverse workforce and is an Equal Opportunity Employer who does not discriminate against employees and applicants for employment on the basis of race, gender, color, religion, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, disability, veteran status, or other classification protected by law.SDL2017

Name: Lead Business Analyst
Description: SUMMARY The Lead Business Analyst acts as a facilitator and liaison across functional teams and ANSYS IT for all aspects of the development of functional roadmaps that include People, Process and Technology changes. This role aligns strategic goals and objectives with decisions regarding the alignment of capabilities and corresponding investments in key initiatives. The role will partner with the PMO, Application and Functional teams to drive the development of initiative roadmaps. The primary focus is the business motivations, business operations and business analysis frameworks that link these aspects of an enterprise together. RESPONSIBILITIESDevelop and maintain strong partnerships with key business stakeholders and team members.Develop business architecture strategy based on understanding of business strategies and business value of key initiatives.Apply a structured business architectural approach and methodology for capturing key initiatives for the enterprise.Capture enterprise goals that provide traceability through the organization and are mapped to metrics that provide governance in terms of progress toward goals.Capture the relationships among roles, capabilities and functional units and the decomposition of those functions into subunits.Assist with quantifying business benefit and pre-project business solution design.Identify functional interdependencies and cross-silo redundancies that may exist in role alignment, process gaps and overlaps and business capability maturity gaps.Conduct business process modeling and document AS-IS and TO-BE models.Responsible for discovering, gathering, documenting, and vetting high level business and functional requirements for new projects and processes to assess impacts across the enterprise.MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONSBachelor's degreeMinimum 10 years of experience in Business Analysis, Business Process and/or ITMinimum 10 years developing Functional Specifications, Process Flows and Use CasesMinimum 10 years of experience conducting requirement analysis, solving business problems, assessing technical capabilities, and documenting solutionsPREFERRED QUALIFICATIONSSound analytical and problem solving skillsStrong ability to think strategically across the enterpriseBusiness Architecture experience preferredPortfolio Management experience a plusStrong presentation and communication skills which will include organizing meetings with varied participants from multiple functions across the businessMinimal travelCULTURE AND VALUES Culture and values are incredibly important to ANSYS. They inform us of who we are, of how we act. Values aren't posters hanging on a wall or about trite or glib slogans. They aren't about rules and regulations. Our values tell us how we live our lives; how we approach our jobs. Our values are crucial for fostering a culture of winning for our company: Customer focusResults and AccountabilityInnovationTransparency and IntegrityMasteryInclusivenessSense of urgencyCollaboration and Teamwork ANSYS is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
