Name: Sr. Analyst, External Reporting
Description: Job DescriptionResponsibilities:Assist with the preparation of Forms 10Q, 10K and other SEC filings utilizing Workiva WdeskAssist with the preparation of schedules to support financial statements, footnotes and other disclosures in SEC filingsMaintain Workiva Wdesk earnings release tables for Investor RelationsReference Earnings Releases to related Form 10Qs, 10Ks and other supporting documentationReview and tag XBRL for Forms 10Qs and 10Ks in Workiva WdeskAssist with the preparation of Section 16 filingsAssist with the preparation of SEC regulations 3-09 and 3-05 analysisAssist with research related to SEC issuesCoordinate the annual testing of the Quarterly Disclosure packagePrepare and file monthly, quarterly, and annual U.S. Government filings to U.S. Census BureauWork with internal and external auditors and provide requested supporting documentationSpecial projects as neededQualifications:Degree in accountingMinimum three years SEC or public accounting experienceStrong computer skills; Workiva Wdesk a plusStrong oral and written communication skillsCPA or actively seeking certification desired Company DescriptionWho Are We?  Live Nation Entertainment is the world’s leading live entertainment company, comprised of global market leaders: Live Nation Concerts, Live Nation Media & Sponsorship Ticketmaster, and Artist Nation Management. Live Nation Concerts is the largest provider of live entertainment in the world promoting more than 26,000 shows and 80+ festivals annually for nearly 3,300 artists in over 40 countries.  Artist Nation Management is one of the world’s leading artist management companies, representing more than 500 artists. Ticketmaster is the global event ticketing leader with over 480 million tickets sold and more than 12,000 clients worldwide. These businesses power Live Nation Media & Sponsorship to deliver music marketing programs across 900 brands enabling advertisers to tap into the more than 71 million fans Live Nation Entertainment delivers annually through its live event and digital platforms. For additional information, visit www.livenationentertainment.com.  Why Live Nation?  A career at Live Nation will challenge and engage you. It truly is a unique and rewarding environment.  Who are you?  Passionate and motivated. Driven, with an entrepreneurial spirit. Resourceful, innovative, forward thinking and committed. At Live Nation Entertainment, our people embrace these qualities, so if this sounds like you then please read on! Name: Business Systems Analyst (Koch Heat Transfer)
Description: Who are we? Watch to find out!Follow Koch Industries onLinkedInWho are we? Watch to find out!WE ARE KOCH Koch Heat Transfer is seeking an IT Manufacturing Lead at our headquarters in Houston, Texas.  The Koch Heat Transfer group builds on the strength of its companies, incorporating a market-based business philosophy with continuous improvement and development of heat transfer technology for the refining, chemical and upstream industries. The group is built on globally-recognized brands in the tubular heat transfer business, such as BROWN FINTUBE®, ALCO™, ALCO-TWIN™ and BOS-HATTEN™ products. Today we are recognized as a world leader in the supply of specialized and standard shell and tube heat exchangers, double pipe, multi-tube hairpin, and tank heater equipment, including finned tubes. Headquartered in Houston, Texas, the Koch Heat Transfer group is represented in every major country, with manufacturing facilities in the United States (Koch Heat Transfer Company, LP), Canada (Koch Heat Transfer Canada, LP) and sales offices all over the world.  Koch Heat Transfer is hiring an IT Manufacturing Lead who connects with the business to develop and maintain strong working relationships, internalize business strategies, and optimize value capture while supporting digital transformation. We are looking for an individual with strong solution development and IT project management skills. The successful candidate must have good critical thinking skills, self-starter and be willing to stretch themselves both within IT and outside of the IT environment. The person in this role will report to the CIO/President. A Day In The Life COULD Include:Lead the IT capability for Koch Heat Transfer.Analyze business IT systems, identify key requirements, and validate systems to ensure they meet the needs of internal customers.Develop plans and objectives for the Koch Heat Transfer IT capability in order to improve quality of offerings, reduce costs, and position for growth.Partner with the business to align and find opportunities to integrate technology and deliver value added solutions.Participate in systems implementation projects (i.e. requirements documentation, systems configuration, test documentation and execution, issue identification and resolution).Provide in-depth knowledge of the ERP system and identify key business requirements.Manage project scope by thoroughly understanding the business culture, environment and people.Plan, prioritize, and deliver systems enhancements.Support and upgrade implemented systems.Understand enterprise software needs and match those needs with the best available products.Stay up-to-date with new technologies and applications – Innovation is a key priority.Manage IT compliance with policies and regulations.Lead, follow and embrace all the Safety Procedures.Understand and apply Koch’s Market-Based Management® and MBM Guiding Principles.What You Will Need To Bring With You (Requirements):Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, MIS, or related field from an accredited institution.5+ years working experience in IT and on IT Solution Development using modern development platforms (such as .Net, C++, C)5+ years of Project Management experienceExperience working in a Manufacturing Environment3+ years’ experience with SQL Server1+ years’ experience with Office 365 SuiteWilling to travel 10% (domestic and some Canadian Travel)What Will Put You Ahead (Preferred):7+ years’ IT experience working at a manufacturing siteExperience with INFOR LN / VISIBILITY ERP Systems.Experience with MS SharePoint Development.Experience with Microsoft Developer Certifications (MCPD, MCSD or MCAD).Experience with Web Development.Proven track record of enabling business outcome through the application of technology.Experience with cloud technologies and data analytics concepts.Why work for Koch Companies?A culture that places top priority on integrity and complianceOpportunity for career growth at one of the largest, financially stable companies in the worldEncouragement to challenge the status quo and share knowledgeAccess to professional training and mentoringResponsibilities and rewards based on contributions rather than seniorityContinued company growth due to reinvesting 90% of our earnings Based in Wichita, Kan., Koch Industries, Inc. is one of the largest private companies in America with estimated annual revenues as high as $115 billion, according to Forbes. It owns a diverse group of companies involved in refining, chemicals, grain processing and biofuels; forest and consumer products; fertilizers; polymers and fibers; process and pollution control equipment and technologies; electronic components; commodity trading; minerals; energy; ranching; glass; and investments. Since 2003, Koch companies have invested approximately $65 billion in acquisitions and other capital expenditures. With a presence in about 60 countries, Koch companies employ more than 100,000 people worldwide, with about 60,000 of those in the United States. From January 2009 to present, Koch companies have earned more than 930 awards for safety, environmental excellence, community stewardship, innovation, and customer service. For more news and stories, visit www.kochnews.com.  The businesses’ popular consumer brands include Brawny® paper towels, Quilted Northern® and Angel Soft® bath tissue, Dixie® tabletop products, LYCRA® fiber, STAINMASTER® carpet and more.  Want to learn more about Koch Heat Transfer?Salary and benefits commensurate with experience.  We are an equal opportunity employer. Minority/Female/Disabled/VeteranExcept where prohibited by state law, all offers of employment are conditioned upon successfully passing a drug test.  This employer uses E-Verify. Name: Actuarial Business Analyst
Description: Functional Area:AC - ActuarialEstimated Travel Percentage (%): No TravelRelocation Provided: NoAmerican General Life Insurance CompanyPreferred location for this role is Houston, TX, but other locations, including remote will be considered for exceptional candidates.  The primary purpose of the job is to provide Business Analysis services in support of the development of the Actuarial Data Repository managed by the Actuarial Information Technology group.  The Annuity Data Team needs a strong Business Analyst, with technical and annuity backgrounds, to understand Business Processes and prepare Business Requirement Documentation by working closely with Actuarial Information Technology stakeholders and actuarial business users.  The project supports the actuarial department’s growing data needs. We need a strong resource to thoroughly understand, analyze, and document system processes and stakeholder information needs while following best practices. Successful candidates should be self-driven, able to work with minimum supervision, and have extensive experience in analyzing and documenting data-driven and information analysis business processes.  Responsibilities Include:  - Develop complete formal data requirements on annuity products (fixed, variable, and indexed) from multiple data sources, including administrative systems, for use in actuarial projection models  - Assist with data validation, including the creation and execution of test plans on data builds by comparing to alternate data sources, verifying transformation algorithms applied, checking internal consistency of data, and reviewing quality of supplied data  - Provide feedback to actuaries and IT staff regarding analysis performed  - Participate in Business Requirement walk through.  - Interpret/explain Business Requirements and coordinate with Developers for New Requirements/Issue Resolutions/Change Requests.  - Coordinate with Admin System DBAs on identification and extraction of Source data.  - Prepare Mapping Documentation for all stages of data flow from Source to Target  - Prepare Data Dictionary for data marts  - Create and track Plan for loading of data every Month/Quarter from several Admin Systems/Sources.  - Interact/coordinate with SMEs/Business teams for New Requirements/Issue Resolutions/Change Requests.  - Participate in daily / weekly scrum calls with the team.  The Ideal Candidate Should Have:  - At least 1 year of actuarial experience with annuity products, or 3+ years IT experience with direct support of annuity business and excellent understanding of annuities  - Experience with annuity administrative systems is a plus  - Experience documenting requirements for large and complex data processing and analysis projects  - Experience in Data Modeling, Data Warehousing, or ETL processing  - Knowledge of PL/SQL, or equivalent database environment, is required  - Strong attention to detail in both work performed and presentation of work products  - Experience communicating and interacting with all levels of management in the process of gathering requirements  - Experience working in controlled development, testing and production environments  - Experience with issue tracking/project planning applications (JIRA).  - Familiarity with standard development toolkits including source repositories (TFS) is a plus  - Demonstrated ability to work as part of a team  - Solid work ethic, self-driven with the ability to work with minimal supervision.  It has been and will continue to be the policy of American International Group, Inc., its subsidiaries and affiliates to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We provide equal opportunity to all qualified individuals regardless of race, color, religion, age, gender, gender expression, national origin, veteran status, disability or any other legally protected categories.  At AIG, we believe that diversity and inclusion are critical to our future and our mission – creating a foundation for a creative workplace that leads to innovation, growth, and profitability. Through a wide variety of programs and initiatives, we invest in each employee, seeking to ensure that our people are not only respected as individuals, but also truly valued for their unique perspectives.

Name: Business Analyst with Yoh
Description: The position listed below is not with Houston Interviews but with Yoh  Houston Interviews is a private organization that works in collaboration with government agencies to promote emerging careers. Our goal is to connect you with supportive resources to supplement your skills in order to attain your dream career.  The DS&C IMPACT Business Analyst is responsible for ensuring that the application properly supports the Downstream and Chemicals (DS&C) IMPACT application. Primary responsibilities include liaising with DS&C representatives, including end users and management, to ensure the application functions as expected, that new enhancements are properly defined, designed and implemented. Other duties include support with Change Management and general communication related to the application, tracking of work and identification of application improvements.  General duties include: formulating and defining system scope using information technology and industry knowledge/requirements, based on both user needs and a good understanding of information technology, business processes, and industry requirements. Responsibilities range from assisting, formulating and defining systems scope and objectives, to self-directed activities that support the application, the business processes and the end users. Name: University Recruiting: Information Technology Intern: Security, Technologist, Business Analyst
Description: This job posting is for Information Technology intern candidates only. Other submissions will not be reviewed or considered.Information Technology Services Summer Intern As a LyondellBasell IT Services (ITS) Summer Intern, you will participate in our structured Information Technology Services (ITS) College Internship Program. The program has been designed to expose the student to multiple disciplines of information technology within a large enterprise over a condensed, 10 to 12-week period during the summer. There are three different information technology summer internship roles at LyondellBasell, as outlined below. Every effort will be made to align your degree plan and career desires to an internship that will incrementally advance your education and promote your career aspirations. All roles are challenging and are a true representation of your future career in information technology. ITS Security Technologist Intern The IT Services Security Technologist Intern will rotate through different Information Protection, Architecture and Compliance (IPAC) groups within our IT Services (ITS) Security organization over the course of the summer internship program. In the ITS Security organization, the intern will acquire hands-on experience in conducting internal ITS audits and supporting various ITS compliance team initiatives as outlined below. The intern will also work with management in a different ITS organization, Infrastructure, and will assist the Systems and Platforms team in different areas of Security Foundation.  The IT Services Security Technologist Intern will have the opportunity to develop basic skills and gain an understanding of professional and departmental standards. Position OverviewMaster technologies, techniques and practices within the ITS Operations Desktop and Server Construction group (user facing security operations).Successfully complete LyondellBasell basic forensic processes (legal hold and investigation requests).Assist in the development, automation and delivery of security related metrics reports.Participate and support SIEM log analysis, incident detection and mitigation scriptingProvide support to the business in helping them to understand the risks, the priorities and the remediation recommendations.Assist IPAC in performing audits as part of their annual ITS audit plan and assist in assessing whether controls are in compliance with ISO27001, Sarbanes-Oxley 404 and other regulations.Meet with employees in other parts of the company to understand the function being audited, preparing audit work papers and participating in team projects.Complete challenging assignments as they arise in the ITS Operations enterprise computing foundational group (security standards in computing equipment).Will be assigned to and work with IPAC organization mentors to assist in key projects and initiatives.Participate in cyber security eventsHelp drive process standardization and proactively recommend improvements.QualificationsWorking toward a Bachelor's degree in CS, CIS, CE, MIS or other business-related finance, economics or engineering fieldsOverall GPA of 3.0 or greaterKnowledge of MS Office tools (Office 365, Outlook, Excel & Word. The Intern will collaborate between ITS and one or more other LyondellBasell business groups for the purpose of achieving sustained improvements. Name: Business Systems Analyst (SQL, Epic) - Institutional Analytics & Informatics
Description: Institutional Analytics & Informatics Vision:  Enable informatics and analytics across service lines by providing the right information to the right people at the right time with the right tools. The Insitutional Analytics & Informatics team is focused on building the infrastructure and creating the capabilities necessary for sustainable clinical data delivery. With ongoing changes in the national health care environment, data will be increasingly required to optimize medical practice. Effective health care delivery must be of high quality and at a reasonable cost. Clinical information management using enterprise-wide vocabularies, data modeling, business intelligence solutions and natural language processing are key enabling technologies. We are the enterprise data architects and infrastructure experts.  Participating in the gathering and documentation of functional, technical, integration, and data requirements in order to design, develop, test, implement and support enterprise data integration, data warehousing, and reporting in a complex environment.  Requirements Gathering & Solution Design Specifications Gather, analyze and document business, technical, integration, and data requirements for complex systems.  Performs process analysis, including feasibility studies, functional requirements analysis and review, detail design reviews, and process workflows.  Converts requirements into comprehensive detailed technical design specifications (source to target mappings, integrations, databases, data flows, transformations, interfaces, reports, etc.) for solutions.  Business Analysis Leadership Maintains effective relationships with customers, vendors, project team members and management. Acts as a liaison between the business customers and technical resources.  Assists in development of strategies, policies, procedures and standards, taking into consideration applicable governmental regulations and institutional policies and procedures. Ensures that functional and technical development, configuration and processes adhere to standards.  Identifies, recommends and incorporates quality assurance and risk mitigation activities into solutions. Participates in the development of plans for contingency, backout, recovery, conversions/cut-overs and decommissioning of systems after migration activities.  Communicates problems / issues that may arise in determining solution feasibility and alternatives to the project manager or manager.  Testing, Implementation & Support Performs and/or assists in activities related to the assessment, implementation, testing, and support of data integration and warehouse systems.  Plans, develops, and executes comprehensive testing efforts, including creating test plans, strategies and both developing and executing test scripts. Performs high level data validation to determine if code is working correctly.  Reviews and provides input for data models and reports. May coordinate or assist in creating models or developing reports.  Assists with effective and timely issue resolution and risk mitigation, seeking input from other MDACC resources and/or vendors as appropriate.  May design and develop training materials and coordinate training sessions for customers. **In order to be adequately prepared and trained to build, test and optimize the Epic system, MDA requires that Epic certification be obtained within 120 days of completion of the assigned, required training classes. Required certifications must be maintained as assigned.** Education Required:  Bachelor's degree.  Preferred Education:  Master's Level Degree  Certification: None  Preferred Certification:  Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP)  Experience Required:  Two years experience in Epic software, domain, project management or workflow analysis. May substitute required education degree with additional years of equivalent experience on a one to one basis or completed years of college on a one to one basis.  Preferred Experience:  Experience with SQL, Epic Clarity, Oracle HDWF, Big Data, and/or Hadoop.  Experience implementing a clinical data warehouse in a healthcare environment  Project management experience. **In order to be adequately prepared and trained to build, test and optimize the Epic system, MDA requires that Epic certification be obtained within 120 days of completion of the assigned, required training classes. Required certifications must be maintained as assigned.** Onsite Presence: Is Required  It is the policy of The University of Texas MD Anderson Cancer Center to provide equal employment opportunity without regard to race, color, religion, age, national origin, sex, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, disability, protected veteran status, genetic information, or any other basis protected by institutional policy or by federal, state or local laws unless such distinction is required by law. http://www.mdanderson.org/about-us/legal-and-policy/legal-statements/eeo-affirmative-action.html Additional InformationEmployee Status: RegularMinimum Salary: US Dollar (USD) 68,400Midpoint Salary: US Dollar (USD) 85,500Maximum Salary : US Dollar (USD) 102,600

Name: ERP Business Analyst III - EPSi
Description: About UsHarris Health is a nationally recognized health system comprising three teaching hospitals and an extensive network of ambulatory care centers serving the people of Harris County, Texas, since 1966. Staffed by the faculty, fellows and residents from two nationally ranked medical schools, Baylor College of Medicine and The University of Texas Health Science Center at Houston (UTHealth), Harris Health is the first healthcare system in Houston to receive the prestigious National Committee for Quality Assurance (NCQA) designation for its network of patient-centered medical homes.  Each year, Harris Health provides more than 1.8 million total outpatient visits through its more than 40 ambulatory care facilities. Additionally, Harris Health sees more than 177,000 emergency visits at its Level 1 and Level 3 trauma centers and 35,000 hospital admissions through its three hospitals: Ben Taub, LBJ and Quentin Mease.  Established by voter referendum to enhance the level of charity care available in the community, Harris Health System has often received national recognition for serving those in need and for its achievements in operational excellence, such as being named to the 2011, 2012, 2013 and 2014 Most Wired Hospitals lists by the American Hospital Association’s Hospitals & Health Networks magazine. Additionally, Harris Health System is pleased that each of its three hospitals — Ben Taub, Lyndon B. Johnson and Quentin Mease — achieved Pathway to Excellence™ designation by the American Nurses Credentialing Center.Job ProfileThe ERP Business Analyst III - EPSi ensures that the operational interests of their respective functional areas are being fully represented in the day-to-day operations of the Information Technology Department. This role supports several applications deployed within the Harris Health System , including  PeopleSoft Human Resources (HCM), Financials (FS) and Supply Chain (SCM)  Kronos Workforce Timekeeping and Advanced Scheduling. This particular position supports our EPSi decision support application software and related interfaces with our PeopleSoft system.MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS: Education/Specialized Training/Licensure: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related degree, or four (4) years of related IT work experience in lieu of a degree.  Work Experience (Years and Area): 5 Years within Information System (I.S.). At least three (3) years PeopleSoft, Kronos experience. EPSi support experience along with budgeting, accounting and financial reporting highly preferred.SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS:Communication Skills: Above Average Verbal (Heavy Public Contact)  Exceptional Verbal (e.g., Public Speaking)  Writing /Composing (Correspondence / Reports) Other Skills: Analytical, Design, Research, Statistical Advanced Education: Bachelors Degree Major: Computer Science or Related  Work Schedule: On Call Other Requirements: Understands functional processes and business rules related to the applications being implemented/supported.  Understands the limitations and opportunities presented by the applications supported.  Understands how application layer security is assigned and works.  Demonstrates adaptability and flexibility in the face of changing demands.  Ability to exceed customer expectation, quality, and productivity.  Provide production support for the ERP applications, including participation in a 24×7 on-call support rotation.  Participate in production changes that may occur after 5:00p.m. or on weekendsBenefits and EEOCHarris Health System benefits program is designed to provide you with more flexibility and choices in meeting your specific needs. Harris Health System benefits program allows you to protect your income in case of illness, death and disability, and to help you save for retirement.  It is the policy of Harris Health System to provide equal opportunity for all applicants for employment regardless political affiliation, race, color, national origin, age, sex, religious creed or disability. Applicants may request any reasonable accommodation(s) to participate in the application process.Job CategoryInformation Technology

Name: WBT Oracle Business Intelligence Analyst
Description: JOB SUMMARY The Business Intelligence Analyst II is a key contributor to the IT Application delivery strategy by supporting the Director, Applications Delivery’s vision, and leadership. The Business Intelligence Analyst II is responsible for developing solutions to the business needs of an organization by exploiting data generated by various operational systems.  The Business Intelligence Analyst II has skills in eliciting, analyzing, validating and documenting business needs provided by the BRM team and the ability to leverage the appropriate database and reporting technologies to present business data in an easily accessed and understood manner.  The Business Intelligence Analyst II has an excellent understanding of business processes and the ability to create reports, dashboards, and scorecards by analyzing data across multiple and diverse business applications and databases.  The role will internally consult with the BRM, EA and business clients to coordinate with other team members to design, build and manage product enhancements and requests, where applicable based on business need.  The Business Intelligence Analyst II is passionate about timely and trustworthy information and the technologies used to deliver value to Wellbore Technologies strategic vision. The role is an integral part of an enterprise-wide Business Intelligence program, with opportunities to grow into a bigger role.PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES § General Requirements Analysis  § Research, identify and document the organization's reporting and information handling requirements  § Develop and document the design of business rules, mappings, and test scenarios  § Develop and document code in keeping with established processes and standards  § Debug and unit test modules before deployment to QA environment  § Create and maintain project documentation in accordance with established standards  § Solution Development and Delivery  § Develop business models, data relationships and presentation models  § Create data visualization products, including reports, charts, dashboards, and scorecards  § Leverage the functionality of the supported reporting tools to enhance user experience  § Coordinate with sponsors, technical staff, and developers to resolve issues  § Understand standard systems development lifecycle processes and apply the methodology effectively  § Application Support  § Provide support to the user base and provide solutions to problems encountered in processing information. Work with users with in the IS group as well as users to identify causes of difficulties, research potential solutions within existing software and, if the resolution is determined to be a system modification, assist the user in the design of the change request  § Develop training agendas and assist in training employees in the tools used in their job functions  § Respond to system modification requests, determining first if the goals can be achieved within the software being implemented or by way of a business process change  § Work with the technical and business teams to resolve the requests  § Should there be system modifications made, aid in the design, testing, deployment, and documentation of these changes  § Initiate, coordinate and participate in system optimization efforts for all sites  § Communicate technical issues effectively to “non-technical” personnel  § Take ownership of existing applications as assigned  § Provide timely response to support requestsJOB REQUIREMENTS § Demonstrate a high degree of proficiency in the use and application of data warehousing and reporting software, e.g. source data, business process modeling, metadata, and presentation systems  § Demonstrate the ability to optimize performance of reporting tools  § Demonstrate familiarity with other reporting and data warehousing concepts such as:  o Kimball Conformed-Dimensional design  o Data Extract-Loading-Transformation (ELT) design  o Database Administration  § Demonstrate expertise with financial systems, concepts, and metrics  § Project management experience  § Participate in weekly update meetings to keep informed on status of projects  § Manage business relationships in a professional manner  § Experience with other similar BI environments such as Tableau, Power BI, Cognos, MicroStrategy, Hyperion, etcBEHAVIORAL COMPETENCIES § Proactively initiate, develop, and maintain effective working relationship with team members  § Recognize the strengths and weaknesses of each team member  § Demonstrate the ability to cooperate with a variety of people and achieve results  § Promote active listening with team members  § Contribute appropriately to conversations  § Assist in the facilitation of team and client meetings  § Accurately prepare written business correspondence that is coherent, grammatically correct, effective, professional, and engaging  § Understand how to communicate difficult/sensitive information tactfully  § Suggest areas for improvement in internal processes along with possible solutions  § Actively contribute to internal programs  § Accurately complete and submit time and expense reports in a timely manner  § Accurately complete and submit status reports in a timely mannerLeadership abilities § Follow through with commitments and foster mutual trust with fellow employees  § Assume additional responsibility without being asked  § Encourage fellow team members to make innovative contributions and embrace new ideas  § Proactively seek opportunities to broaden and deepen knowledge base and proficiencies  § Share acquired skills with team members through formal and informal channels  § Encourage more junior employees to take responsibility for their development within the companyTECHNICAL COMPETENCIES § Experience working in multi-discipline, high performing work teams/groups in a multicultural environment  § Understanding of the current BI platform and utilizing the tools proficiently  § Ability to work on multiple complex and at times, competing projects  § Ability to apply continuous improvement processes  § Knowledge of the latest technology innovations and their applicability to business operations  § Understanding of IT service delivery concepts and procedures§ University degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Systems, or related discipline. Masters preferred.  § 3-5 years of experience with BI environments, including the mapping of source to target data, documenting requirements, designing, conducting data quality tests, and creating reports and dashboards  § Hands-on proficiency with SQL required  § Hands-on experience with financial systems preferred; this could be in the capacity of university training, or Oracle Hyperion or similar systems usage  § Hands-on proficiency with Business Intelligence tools such as OBIEE, Power BI and/or Tableau.

Name: Consulting Business Systems Analyst

Name: Business Systems Analyst - (NLP) Natural Language Processing
Description: The University of Texas MD Anderson Cancer Center in Houston is one of the world's most respected centers focused on cancer patient care, research, education and prevention. It was named the nation's No. 1 hospital for cancer care in U.S. News & World Report's 2017 rankings. It is one of the nation's original three comprehensive cancer centers designated by the National Cancer Institute.  The Business Systems Analyst (BSA) is responsible for participating in the gathering and documentation of functional, technical, integration, and data requirements in order to design, development, test, implement and support enterprise/clinical text analytics and Natural Language Processing (NLP), data integration in a complex environment.  The Business Systems Analyst is responsible for participating in NLP performance validation for precision and recall. Gather requirements, design and develop solutions Gather and document functional, technical, integration, and data requirements, provide expertise in the activities of design, development, testing, issue resolution, and support of complex text analytics and NLP models.  • Assist in identifying the scope and needs of source data and actively gathers detailed business requirements and business rules of content extraction.  • Analyzes, gathers, and documents business requirements.  • Converts requirements into comprehensive detailed design specifications (business process and data flow, business rules of content extraction, etc.) for solutions.  • Build Text Analytics and NLP Information Models and analyze test results and iteratively update model to meet precision and recall requirements.  • Build, customize, optimize data dictionary used in text analytics and NLP.  • Documents detailed design specifications using appropriate standardized documentation.  • Planning, development, and execution of testing efforts.  • Identifies and resolves project issues. Identifies, recommends and incorporates quality assurance and risk mitigation activities into issue resolutions/solutions.  • Has a fundamental understanding of technical concepts.  Provides business analysis leadership for projects • Acts as a liaison between the business customers and technical resources on projects.  • Attends and contributes at regular meetings with both business and technical staff.  • Identifies and resolves migration issues effectively and in a timely manner  • Seeks input from other MDACC resources and/or vendor input to resolve application issues when appropriate.  • Has knowledge of governmental regulations and institutional Policies and Procedures  • Participates in the development of plans for contingency, backout, recovery, conversions/cut-overs and decommissioning of systems after migration activities.  • Performs high level data validation to determine if code is working correctly.  Perform assessment, implementation, testing, and support • Performs process analysis, including feasibility studies, functional requirements analysis and review, detail design reviews, process workflows, and clinical assessments.  • Performs comprehensive testing activities including creating test plans, strategies and both developing and executing test scripts.  • Participate in NLP performance validation for precision and recall.  • Assists in development of strategies, policies, procedures and standards.  • Coordination and adherence to functional and technical development, configuration of process standards mandated by either MDACC and provides justification for any deviation.  • Assists with issue resolution and risk mitigation.  • Communicates problems / issues that may arise in determining solution feasibility and alternatives to the project manager or manager.  • Maintains effective relationships with customers, vendors, project team members and management.  • May design and develop training materials and coordinate training sessions for customers.  • Provides positive feedback to team members when they make a positive contribution. Education Required:  Bachelor's degree.  Preferred Education:  Computer Science or Mathematics degree  Experience:  Two years experience in domain, project management ,workflow analysis or Epic software,. May substitute required education degree with additional years of equivalent experience on a one to one basis or completed years of college on a one to one basis.  Preferred Experience:  •Experience implementing text analytics, text mining, and/or NLP in a healthcare environment  •Experience working in and a well-rounded knowledge of the MD Anderson IT environment.  •Experience in health care environment (hospitals, or drugs not insurance companies)  •Project management experience  Onsite Presence: Is Required  It is the policy of The University of Texas MD Anderson Cancer Center to provide equal employment opportunity without regard to race, color, religion, age, national origin, sex, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, disability, protected veteran status, genetic information, or any other basis protected by institutional policy or by federal, state or local laws unless such distinction is required by law. http://www.mdanderson.org/about-us/legal-and-policy/legal-statements/eeo-affirmative-action.html Additional InformationEmployee Status: RegularMinimum Salary: US Dollar (USD) 68,400Midpoint Salary: US Dollar (USD) 85,500Maximum Salary : US Dollar (USD) 102,600

Name: Analyst
Description: Argus is a fast-growing global B2B media company providing essential information to the energy industry. Argus benchmarks are used globally throughout the energy sector for formula pricing in contracts, as a taxation reference, in investment planning and for a variety of other purposes.  Argus is seeking a strong technical analyst to assist our growing consulting team with research and production of consulting studies with particular focus on North American crude and refining markets. Key ResponsibilitiesOversee data integrity, data flow and produce and develop crude and refined products related databases and products, with focus on the Americas.Build related financial (net cash flow) models and forecasting models.Maintain current knowledge of major drivers and trends across the industry and liaise with Argus global team to ensure sharing and cooperation.Contribute and actively participate in research reports and presentations.Maintain and improve data integrity, and optimized and efficient data flowKnowledge, Skills, and ExperienceBachelor’s degree in Engineering, Economics, Business or industry-related fields required5 – 10 years industry experience within the energy industry, specifically in the Americas refining and refined product markets.5 years minimum experience in conducting local and global market analysis that reflect economic drivers, supply/demand fundamentals, trade flows, etc.Research and analysis experience from planning departments and/or consulting positions a plus.Integrated petrochemical, feedstock, biofuels and RINs/LCFS credit market experience a plus.Self-starter with entrepreneurial desire to become a contributing Consultant, and to build and expand a business while developing subject matter expertise.Strong verbal and written communication skills.Strong attention to detail, organized, and able to prioritize projects to ensure tight deadlines are met.Proficiency with MS Applications (Word, Power Point), Excel (pivot tables and macros). Experience with databases a plus.About Argus Argus is an independent media organization with over 900 full time staff. It is headquartered in London and has offices in each of the world’s principal commodity centers. Its main activities comprise publishing market reports containing price assessments, market commentary and news, and business intelligence reports that analyze market and industry trends.  Argus is a leading provider of data on prices and fundamentals, news, analysis, consultancy services and conferences for the global crude, oil products, LPG, natural gas, electricity, coal, emissions, bioenergy, fertilizer, petrochemical, metals and transportation industries. Data provided by Argus are widely used for indexation of physical trade. Companies, governments and international agencies use Argus information for analysis and planning purposes. Employee BenefitsCompetitive salaryGroup medical, dental and vision plansCompany paid long term disability and life insurance planGroup 401(k) safe harbor retirement plan with a 6% company match15 vacation days your first year, which increases up to 25 daysSubsidized gym membershipExtensive internal and external trainingEqual Opportunity Employer/Veterans/Disabled

Name: Technology Planning Analyst
Description: Basic Function: This position combines the technical roles of a typical petroleum or geoscience petrotech with the business and financial analytical skills of business support personnel. The candidate will be responsible for providing routine technical support to the Upstream Group to meet Saudi Aramco Upstream requests for technical and other services and provide staff assistance in departmental planning and/or program activities. This responsibility includes data management and analyses, special technology studies, performance indices and trends, and supporting other relevant business programs. Duties & Responsibilities:Work with petroleum engineering and geoscience groups to collect and analyze data for technical reportsMine industry databases to access and analyze technical and financial informationCoordinate the preparation of special reports for review and approvalConduct special studies as assignedWork with corporate groups in maintaining the flow of business information to assist Department Manager and Division Heads in keeping operations, manpower, financial budgets within established programs and standardsConduct studies relating to technology, productivity and effective utilization of funds and resources or other areas of concernDevelop cost control measures to meet cost, schedule, or program objectivesProvide and record operations performance data with particular emphasis on portrayal of trendsProvide for the development and maintenance of statistical reports, visual presentations and others for management purposesSolve problems and handle other matters such as those related to technology, operations, personnel administration, and emergency needs as assignedHandle work such as auditing invoices from contractors, interpreting contract provisions, checking correctness or arranging for corrections; monitor contractor performance; monitor contract performance for compliance or provide assistance and support in procurementPerform other duties as assignedEducation and Experience:Bachelor's Degree in Math/Statistics, Economics, Information Technology, Business Administration, Accounting, Financial Management or closely related specialty requiredOne (1) year data management, data analysis, project management or other closely related experience required, one (1) year of petroleum-related experience preferred; some exposure to oil company operations and terminology necessaryMust have excellent written and oral presentation skillsMust know how and when to use a wide variety of statistical and financial analytical tools and have a working knowledge of economics, technology and accountingMust be able to communicate and comprehend both orally and in writing, accurately, clearly and concisely in English at the high level required to perform the job as outlinedMust possess good work habits, a strong work ethic, and be able to adhere to company work hours, policies, and standard business etiquetteNO THIRD PARTY CANDIDATES ACCEPTED

Name: Portfolio Management Analyst
Description: NRG is the leading integrated power company in the U.S., built on the strength of our diverse competitive electric generation portfolio and leading retail electricity platform. A Fortune 500 company, NRG creates value through best-in-class operations, reliable and efficient electric generation, and a retail platform serving residential and commercial businesses. Working with electricity customers large and small, we implement sustainable solutions for producing and managing energy, developing smarter energy choices and delivering exceptional service as our retail electricity providers serve almost three million residential and commercial customers throughout the country.  More information is available at www.nrg.com. Connect with NRG Energy on Facebook and follow us on Twitter @nrgenergy.  Summary: Green Mountain Energy (GME) markets and sells renewable electricity in the competitive Texas retail electricity markets. To support and drive financial and operational performance of GME's Texas residential business, candidate will perform a diverse range of assignments, projects and activities related to financial planning, supply management and portfolio optimization. Additionally, the incumbent will be expected to challenge existing business practices, propose workable solutions and drive initiatives to completion. Responsibilities:Develop, support and maintain a robust suite of financial forecasting modelsProvide management with accurate and timely financial and operational reports that will support business decisionsPropose strategic recommendations that will enhance business value and drive performance improvement related to financial and operational metrics customer count, acquisition, retention, and EBITDAMonitor, analyze and report key performance metricsLead special projects to address pressing business needsIdentify opportunities for improvement and engage in cross-functional initiatives to drive process improvementQualifications:Education:Bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university requiredDegree in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Finance or Engineering preferredExperience:3+ years work experience required, preferably in one of the following areas: Financial Forecasting, Market Analytics, Supply Management or Risk ManagementAdditional Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:Strong computer and analytical skills including proficiency in MS Excel, SAS (or equivalent) and/or SQLRevenue forecasting, gross margin analysis or P&L reporting experience preferredDeregulated retail and wholesale electricity markets experience requiredRobust analytical, mathematical and statistical skillsAbility to understand, manage and compile large data setsDetail oriented and highly organizedHigh integrity, energy, enthusiasm and tenacityProven experience delivering projects on-timeAble to effectively communicate to a wide range of audiences in both written and oral formPhysical Requirements:Occasionally requires lifting as appropriate to perform duties and responsibilitiesWorking Conditions:Primarily an office environmentSome overtime required as special projects arise NRG Energy is committed to a drug and alcohol free workplace. To the extent permitted by law and any applicable collective bargaining agreement, employees are subject to periodic random drug testing, and post-accident and reasonable suspicion drug and alcohol testing. Data Visualization Tool or Process Modelling tool such as at least one of the following: Tableau, MS Visio, ARIS, ERWin.Any suitable combination of education, training or experience is acceptable. Strong business and communication skills to elicit and document complex business requirements. Strong understanding of business processes, application interfaces, data workflows, reporting, etc. Excellent interpersonal and collaboration skills to work with multi-disciplined teams. Proficiency using MS Office and other tools for documentation and reports. Name: Pricing Analyst
Description: Introduction Bigge Crane and Rigging Co. (www.bigge.com) is the one of the fastest growing and most aggressive crane rental companies in the United States. Since 1916, we have been building Americas landmarks, and we are proud to have created one of the highest performing equipment companies in the world.  Bigge is leading the transformation of the crane and rigging industry with a unique approach to maintaining the best experience, equipment and technology in the market. Leveraging our innovative technology platform, we are forging new ground in the areas of safety, equipment utilization and employee growth. Summary/Objective: Reporting to the Director of Pricing Strategy, this key role partners with multiple departments across Bigge to develop and execute pricing strategies that drive incremental sales and profit. Critical to our growth, this data analyst designs and drives effective and scalable revenue management plans to support our overall business strategy. This role is part of a high-profile corporate initiative and includes significant potential for growth as the business develops greater revenue management capabilities. What you'll do:Support execution of pricing changes with thoughtful analysisMaintain pricing database to support strategic analysis, management reporting, financial forecasting & analysis.Review price changes with Sales Leadership Team to ensure alignment with distributors.Provide Regional Sales teams with price change information to enable execution.Ensure organizational visibility into pricing execution progress and develop ongoing tracking and analysis of pricing related outcomes that is shared monthly with the Senior Leadership Team.Support implementation of pricing systems & tools, working closely with the sales & business systems teams.Identify and drive process improvements across all facets of pricing management.Proactively identify actionable opportunities and develop recommendations on pricing programs to drive incremental sales and profit.Design pricing strategies for new products and packages.Analyze performance results of pricing activities including promotional effectiveness.Embed strategic thinking on price within the organization through relationships & training; develop relationships to become a trusted thought partner.Assist in development and delivery of presentations to senior leaders as required.Involvement & ownership in annual planning and revenue forecasting.Other duties and projects as directed.What we're looking for:5 years of experience in an analytical function, with 3 years of experience specific to pricingBachelor's degree requiredStrong analysis skills and presentation ability a must.Expert knowledge of pricing & price promotion dynamics.Advanced Microsoft Excel & PowerPoint skills, solid technical aptitude, and a willingness to learn and adapt to various new technologies.Effective communication, administrative, and interpersonal skills with the ability to be persuasive.Excellent written and verbal communication skills and strong attention to detail.Ability to adapt to in a fast-paced environment.High degree of initiative and ownership, as well as a proven history of delivering results while working with several different departments in a fast-paced environment.Demonstrated ability to work across all departments in a company; ability to collaborate in a team environment, while also working independently.Self-starter who requires minimal guidance.Strong attention to detail, problem solving, prioritization, and organizational skills.Knowledge of financial planning processes, valuation practices, data management.Crane or heavy equipment experience not required. Bigge is seeking outside perspective to drive this initiative Bigge provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, genetics, military or veteran status.

Name: Business Analyst (Dallas/Houston, Texas)
Description: Praescient Analytics focuses on combining advanced analytics technologies and methodologies together in order to empower national intelligence and state/local law enforcement communities and their missions. We are implementing an innovative Records Management System (RMS), built by our amazing partner Mark43, as a tool upon which our first responders rely. Our users are diverse, and we are therefore committed to embracing diversity of thought and experience within our team.  We are looking for a Business Analyst to join our teams in Texas (Houston/Dallas) in direct support of numerous Police Departments. You have to be passionate about implementing the next generation of law enforcement technologies as you will work directly with the client to assist with the roll-out of this system, and help drive passionate user adoption throughout the force. This role requires a sharp attention to detail, strong organizational skills, an interest in working directly with customers, and a knack at supporting law enforcement users with revolutionary software. Members of our current team have backgrounds in consulting technical project management, and experience with large SaaS deployment projects.  You will be involved in the full spectrum of implementation of the Mark43 platform at our client sites. You will play a key role assisting your team in researching clients' current technologies, processes, and policies in order to recommend implementation strategies to support the enterprise adoption of the product to clients. In this role you can expect to be deeply involved with understanding and supporting the ultimate users of the product and it's your job to get to know each user from analyst to detective to ensure that they transition their workflows to this new RMS in a way that is effective, elegant, and creates champions of the users. You are our advocates onsite, every day, helping the Police Departments across their diverse and vital mission sets.  What you can expect to work on Working with a team to support this important enterprise software deployment; be able to comfortably shift from speaking to a group of people to a single person on a complex caseAssist with the development, planning, and implementation of product training for users (on scale of 10s to 100s) conduct this training and tailor it to each user's unique abilities and missionSpend time on site with our clients, interacting with stakeholders and guiding them through the different stages of implementationTrack project schedule with stakeholders, help identify schedule risks, and support creation of mitigation strategiesBuild and manage relationships with power-users and influencers within client siteSolicit and organize user feedbackWorking towards a in a customer-facing role, preferably in a project management, business analyst, training, client support, and/or feedback collection roleWillingness to empathize with users who may be unlike yourselfPassion for supporting law enforcement, first responders, and other government agenciesStrong organizational skills and ability to multitaskProficiency in Microsoft Office & Google Technical expertise can be substituted for collection industry experienceThe above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work performed by people assigned to this job. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and requirements.Convergent Outsourcing, Inc., is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE)Any employment offers are contingent upon successfully passing a Criminal Background Check and/or Drug Screen.

Name: Senior Commercial & Business Development Analyst
Description: Description Job Title Senior Commercial & Business Development Analyst Location Houston, TX, US Organization Name Noble Energy Inc Brief DescriptionIdentify, analyze, develop and negotiate commercial and business development opportunities in support of the company’s strategic plan. Generates new ideas for asset management, actively looks for commercial and business development opportunities, develops negotiation strategy and negotiates closure of business deals. Detailed DescriptionPerforms market, industry and economic analysis in support of new projects, including acquisitions and new assets construction.Monitors midstream industry and researches opportunities for growth and expansion in current and future markets.Performs economic analysis to understand risks and viability of potential infrastructure investments.Performs analysis of commodity markets including pricing relationships, supply/demand fundamentals, logistical flows and market competition within specifically assigned geographical areas of focus in support of identifying potential acquisition and investment opportunities.Prepares and negotiates business contracts from inception to closing, including coordinating with internal teams to execute projects.Assists in the formulation and implementation of commercial and business development strategies and works to cultivate new relationships that will provide growth opportunities. Job RequirementsBachelor’s Degree preferably in Business Administration, Finance, or, degree in an applicable oil and gas disciplineTypically requires 3-5 years of industry experience to include financial modeling, midstream operations, project generation and economic analysis, planning and supervisionMBA preferred Additional DetailsPlease go to https://www.nblenergy.com/careers, register your account and submit your resume for consideration. Thank you.  Noble Energy is an Equal Opportunity Employer - Females/Minorities/Veterans/Disabled Apply Now!

Name: Senior Analyst (Fuel and Chemicals)
Description: About the Job As a Senior Analyst with Nexant, you will be part of a highly regarded global team and a member of the premier provider of energy and chemicals consulting solutions to clients who are shaping the future of the world through energy and materials. Join us and you will play an integral role in winning and delivering high-quality consulting projects, which will put your analyst skills to the test in an environment that is supportive and collegial.  As part of our growing team in Houston, you will also work on reports within our Nexant Subscription programs, which provide clients with comprehensive analytics, forecasts and insights in the markets, technologies and economics of a broad range of energy and chemical-related industries, from hydrocarbon fuels and feedstocks, petrochemicals and polymers, C1 chemicals, to biorenewables and special topics.Duties and ResponsibilitiesParticipate in the delivery of consultancy engagements and subscription reports to exceed client's expectations, through research, analysis and report writingConduct primary research to understand key industry issues and develop market balances and projectionsManage research and analysis of industry data through the use of spreadsheetsConduct research on process technology trends and develop economic models of capital and operating costs of industrial plantsMeet internal quality, time and budget constraintsWork closely with clients, prepare and deliver presentations, and assist in building strong client relationshipsDevelop and broaden personal knowledge and capabilitiesAssist and support team members in all aspects of engagement deliveryOther duties may be assigned.QualificationsBachelors or Masters degree, preferably in Chemical Engineering or Chemistry3+ years of industry analysis/consulting, research or process industry experienceAdvanced skills in the use of spreadsheets, word processing and presentation applicationsProficient in the use of databasesExcellent presentation and report writing skillsExcellent mathematical, analytical and problem-solving skillsCapable of developing and maintaining strong client relationshipsPositive and flexible work attitudeDiplomatic in meeting and working with people, good cultural awarenessBe willing to travel locally and nationally 20% of your time.Salary and Benefits (U.S.) Nexant offers competitive salaries based on candidate's qualifications. Nexant also offers three weeks paid vacation per year, eleven paid holidays per year, a 401(k) plan with employee matching funds and an overall comprehensive benefits package. About Nexant Nexant is a globally recognized software, consulting and services leader that provides innovative solutions to utilities, energy enterprises, chemical companies and government entities worldwide. Founded in 2000 and headquartered in San Francisco, Nexant and its 500+ employees work from 26 global offices providing deep technical expertise and regional knowledge to improve customer engagement, boost operational efficiency, reduce costs and achieve superior business results.  Nexant supports clients through four distinct business units: Nexant Energy Software has developed and commercialized a number of industry-leading software platforms and applications, including Nexant iEnergy®, Nexant Grid360, and Nexant iHedge®Nexant Utility Services works with clients to drive customer energy savings, ensure cost-effective program design, implementation and management, and promote customer engagementNexant Energy & Chemicals Advisory provides strategic planning, project development, competitor analysis, market and price forecasting, and Nexant Subscriptions and ReportsNexant Government Services assists developing countries with energy sector policies, infrastructure, financing, and access to affordable electricity. Every day, Nexant employees partner with customers to reimagine the world we live in and create a more sustainable energy tomorrow.  Nexant, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Name: Business Analyst - T8668 -
Description: Targa Resources is a growth-oriented provider of midstream services and is one of the largest independent midstream energy companies in North America, with assets in Texas, New Mexico, Oklahoma, North Dakota, Louisiana, California, Washington and Maryland. Targa owns, operates, acquires, and develops a diversified portfolio of complementary midstream energy assets. We encourage your interest in joining our team and pursuing the many opportunities we have at Targa.  Targa is currently seeking a Business Analyst for their Corporate office located in Houston, TX. Job Responsibilities: The Business Analyst supports the Commercial Vice President and his reports. Support consists of maintaining revenue and production models for the areas of responsibility. Wellhead production estimates, liquid product and gas values, pricing and operating data are input to the revenue models for monthly margin forecasting of the Flash report. The same models are used during the annual budget cycle and the Analyst prepares budget templates and summaries for management review & approval.  The Business Analyst will also be responsible for building Internal Rate of Return/NPV models based on unique scenarios for each project, which will be used for quantifying capital expansion projects for submittal to Executive Management for approval. Additionally the Analyst will be responsible for determining the processing spread and various operational analyses in different economic environments as it relates to the Business Unit. Primary Duties Include: Maintain revenue (Flash) models for the business unit. Wellhead production estimates, product and gas values and operating data are gathered from various in house sources, validated and entered in a time sensitive manner.  Update monthly capital, operational and maintenance expenditures as part of the Flash.  Maintain monthly production forecast model as input to revenue models and ad hoc analysis. Interpretation and analysis of historical production, production decline curves and producer data are required.  Use Flash models as a template to prepare one year and five year projections for the annual budget submission.  Communicate with field personnel and Engineering groups to update monthly capital and operating expenditures as a part of the Flash and annual budget process.  Work with Corporate and Business Planning groups to keep their models up to date.  Develop and maintain economic analysis models to support new projects as well as individual AFE approvals.  Work directly with the team members on various issues of forecasting, accounting reconciliation, discrepancies and other analytical work. Minimum Essential Qualifications: 2+ years of industry related experience in the gas gathering, processing, and/or gas modeling/analysis field required; 5+ years strongly preferred.  Bachelor of Science or Bachelor of Business Administration degree in Finance, Accounting or Engineering or related field.  Advanced spreadsheet skills (MS Excel) & intermediate level skills in other Microsoft Office applications.  Ability to work on multiple, concurrent tasks with tight schedules.  Excellent written and verbal communication skills.  General knowledge of gas gathering, processing operations, and crude oil. Preferred Qualifications: Analytical skills appropriate for economic model development and interpretation.  Travel may be required occasionally, typically consisting of one to three day trips.  Targa offers a very competitive compensation and benefits package.  To apply please go to http://www.targaresources.com/careers/careers-overview  We are proud to be an EEO/AA employer M/F/D/V. We maintain a drug-free workplace and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing.SDL2017

Name: PeopleSoft HCM SR. Functional Analyst
Description: The position requires subject matter expertise in PeopleSoft HCM functional areas (Benefits, Payroll and HR) with experience in business, healthcare and technology projects. The incumbent will be actively involved in supporting, developing and advancing our PeopleSoft HCM application. Sr. Business Analyst facilitates requirements gathering sessions to understand and document complex business needs, often eliciting hidden requirements and/or clarifying vague or unclear requirements. Analyzes business operations and processes to understand strengths and weaknesses. Serves as a coach and mentor to more junior Business Analysts. Delegates tasks as appropriate.  The Sr. Business Analyst is responsible for analysis, functional documentation, configuration, maintenance, testing, and support for business application through upgrades, new releases, and optimization implementations. This position requires critical thinking, attention to detail, and effective communication skills. The position requires the person to have the ability to work collaboratively with teams and to consult with business area leads and analyze issues to generate solution recommendations. Act in a lead role over a particular module and perform the duties of liaison for business areas. The Sr. Business Analyst will also act as a Project Manager for multiple projects, and will assist in coordinating the activities of more junior analysts. The Sr. Business Analyst must be versatile and be able to communicate effectively in front of a group when providing training and education. DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIESPEOPLE 20% Demonstrates strong knowledge of Project Management Methodologies through system implementations.  Initiates and maintains positive relationships with key customers and co-workers.  Acts as a liaison with vendors and participates in vendor or system selections.  Supports and evaluates change management efforts on assigned solutions.  May provide input into team members annual evaluations.  Participates and provide feedback in interviewing process for potential team members.  Demonstrates leadership and management of assigned projects.  Provides training and mentoring for team members through formal and informal methods, and often performs as a team leader.  Develop and document business case/scope/plan, business/functional requirements; including specifications for package solutions, and/or software development.  Functions in a lead role, as projects are implemented, to coordinate development, testing and working out issues with customers and vendors, making changes and corrections as needed; and coordinating communication of changes to customers. FINANCE 10% Coordinates and provides problem resolution, technical analyses, costs and resource estimates, work plans, workflow documentation, and progress reports on assigned projects.  Identifies solutions to optimize performance of existing systems and gains customer consensus on instituting changes; institutes changes when approved.  Demonstrates effective assignment delegation and evaluation of teams work effort.  Serves as a role model for analysts on team and participates in the development and growth opportunities for team members. QUALITY/SAFETY 30% Implements and supports large, complex applications with technical experience in systems analysis, design, building, testing, and implementation.  Partners with the Project Management Office to support all phases of project implementation.  Proactively coordinates regular status sessions with key customers.  Provides oversight for work assigned to team members and evaluates effectiveness of their work product.  Demonstrates commitment to Houston Methodist values and goals to assure the efficient, effective and consistent delivery of high quality services.  Participates in setting, monitoring, and meeting SLAs with key customers.  Manage and coordinate IT activities during the Lifecycle of projects  Develop detailed system test plans, execute system test cases and provide issue tracking and consolidation. Manage a coordinated User Acceptance Test (UAT) effort SERVICE 30% Demonstrates strong communication skills through active collaboration with the customers, proactive updates and alerts customers to potential issues.  Develops clear messaging to customers and management on plans for issue resolution, status updates and their effect on the department to customers.  Partners with customers and team members to translate business requirements into viable solutions, identifying potential benefits, and re-engineering workflow/processes to achieve anticipated benefits.  Coordinates discovery, planning or follow up sessions with key customers.  Participates in managing and resolving major system outages, disaster management and change control.  Actively seeks opportunities to lead initiatives within the organization. GROWTH/INNOVATION 10% Accountable for fostering an environment that encourages innovation, continuous improvement and growth.  Accountable for consistency as changes in process, tools, and overall practice is developed, ensuring a focus on continued integration and overall system benefit.  Provides innovative support for custom Information Technology needs throughout the organization.  This position description is not intended to be all inclusive, and the employee will also perform other reasonably related business duties as assigned by the immediate supervisor and other management as required. We reserve the right to revise or change job duties and responsibilities as the need arises. EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Programming, Business Administration, or equivalent field. EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS Minimum of 7+ years experience using PeopleSoft ERP HCM required. Experience with PeopleSoft ERP system implementation and upgrade required.  Must have at least 7+ years experience in Business Systems Analysis, requirement gathering and documentation as well as strong Project Management technical Skills.  Extensive PC software skills and experience; including Microsoft Word/Excel/Access/ Project, and other database management and reporting software. Experience using SQL and RDMS.  Requires superior documentation expertise, including experience creating Project Scope, Business Requirements, Functional and Nonfunctional Requirements, Workflows, etc.  Background in business process analysis, system requirements, as well as data modeling and detailed functional design  Background in system test planning and execution (UAT)  Advanced analytical thinking and creative problem solving, (ability to define multiple approaches to business problems, exposure to business process re-engineering) SPECIAL KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES REQUIRED Interviewing Skills: The ability to talk with individuals and groups about their needs and ask the right questions to surface essential requirements information.  Listening Skills: The ability to understand what people say and to detect what they might be hesitant to say.  Analytical Skills: The ability to critically evaluate the information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information into details, abstract up from low-level information to a more general understanding, distinguish presented user requests from the underlying true needs, and distinguish solution ideas from requirements.  Facilitation Skills: The ability to engage customers and technicians for the purpose of extracting discussion, ideas, opinions, and general contribution in individual settings, meetings, or to lead requirements elicitation workshops.  Observational Skills: The ability to validate data obtained via other techniques and expose new areas for elicitation.  Writing Skills: The ability to communicate information effectively to customers, marketing, managers, and technical staff.  Organizational Skills: The ability to work with a vast array of information gathered during elicitation and analysis and to cope with rapidly changing information and priorities.  Interpersonal Skills: The ability to help negotiate priorities and to resolve conflicts among customers, technologists, and management. Strong teamwork skills at all levels are critical.  Modeling Skills: The ability to represent requirements information in graphical forms that augment textual representations in natural language.  Problem Solving / Reasoning Skills: The ability to balance theory and practical reality in data warehousing methods/approaches.  Productivity Skills: Ability to evaluate, prioritize and problem solve a variety and multiplicity of tasks and ensure their timely and accurate completion. Also, the ability to work independently and take initiative in areas of responsibility.  Demonstrated experience successfully defining and leading projects.  Demonstrated ability to employ diplomacy and strategic thought leadership to effectively resolve challenges and lead teams to derive solutions.  Able to work in a fast paced environment and be able to meet tight deadlines.  Exceptional oral and written communication skills.  Strong analytical skills with close attention to detail.  Strong organization and prioritization skills.  Experience with organizational design and change management preferred.  A team player that can foster the best out of her/his teammates.  SKILLS AND CERTIFICATIONS [note: bold skills and certification are required] PeopleSoft ERP HCM required (Benefits, Payroll, and HR)Visa Candidate Considered: NoCOMPENSATIONDOE Full-time Benefits - Full  Relocation Assistance Available - Yes  Commission Compensation - No  Bonus Eligible - No  Overtime Eligible - No  Interview Travel Reimbursed - No CANDIDATE DETAILS 7+ to 10 years experience  Seniority Level - Mid-Senior  Management Experience Required - No  Minimum Education - Bachelor's Degree  Willingness to Travel - Never
