Name: Corporate Oversight & Control - Control Management - Technical Business Analyst - Associate
Description: JPMorgan Chase & Co. (NYSE: JPM) is a leading global financial services firm with assets of $2.5 trillion and operations worldwide. The firm is a leader in investment banking, financial services for consumers and small business, commercial banking, financial transaction processing, and asset management. A component of the Dow Jones Industrial Average, JPMorgan Chase & Co. serves millions of consumers in the United States and many of the world's most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients under its J.P. Morgan and Chase brands. Information about JPMorgan Chase & Co. is available at www.jpmorganchase.comFirmwide Oversight and Control (O&C), was designed to ensure a strong and consistent control environment across the organization from front office to back office, regardless of line of business or functional area. With Control Officers appointed for each Line of Business, Function and Region, we have a comprehensive coverage/accountability model that promotes firmwide dialogue and consistency in approach and solutions. The O&C Applications team works collaboratively with other control disciplines and oversees existing control functions as well as the development of new control functions and protocols.This process enables the firm to engage the appropriate teams in a timely manner and provides the ability to quickly remediate critical control issues across all the impacted areas of the firm.The Business Analyst will support O&C Applications Requirements and UAT; working together with O&C and business SMEs to coordinate establish requirements, test, defect triage and escalation of Issues/Risks for the Controls Room. The role will also involve working closely with the technical developers and component testers to ensure testing of requirements have been sequenced correctly for UAT. The successful candidate will need to work with the multiple constituencies to ensure correct reporting of status and appraisal of effort and solutions, and be delivery focused with a keen eye toward program, project and artifact completion to meet deadlines.Key ResponsibilitiesResponsible for helping manage (from a business perspective) the full system development life cycle from business requirements analysis and data feed definition, to data mapping and working with Development, QA and Business teams to facilitate feed, application functionality, and regression testingReview Business Requirements, Functional Specifications, and Test Cases to understand the functional and technical requirements in order to support UAT testing of applications and verify UAT exit criteria are successfully metCreation of detailed UAT plans and strategies to manage the UAT processImplementation of enhancements to the processes and tools to improve management information systems and reporting regarding control issues, at an enterprise-wide levelDevelop an in-depth understanding of monitoring technologies and monitoring strategies. Learn the compliance and regulatory aspects driving Line of Business monitoring needs. Apply this knowledge to improve projects, determine solutions and resolve issuesManage/participate in multiple project work-streams concurrentlyQualifications:Minimum of 2 years of experience as a Business Analyst, preferably in the Finance or Technology IndustrySignificant experience in systems development life cycle (SDLC) ideally using an Agile type methodology.  Experience developing Business Requirements, Functional Specifications, Process Flows, Use Cases, UAT Scripts and designing reportsStrong analytical skills, problem-solving, detail oriented, interpersonal and writing skills (including meeting minutes/documentation)Flexible and adaptive; demonstrated ability to work in a fast paced demanding environmentExperience project managing small to large scale projectsExperience working with varied levels of managementExperiencing working in both team and independent environmentsAbility to multitask in a dynamic environmentAdvanced skills for MS Office Suite applications (Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Visio, Project)Bachelor's degree in Management Information Systems, Finance, or related field.Project management and programming experience a plus (Experience with SQL, Java, C, C++, XML, SQL, HTML, and Visual Basic)

Name: RCO Campaign Execution Analyst

Retail Operations Analyst Houston, TX  6+ month contract  Summary: The Mass Operations group provides operational analysis and implementation support for Retail mass marketing products, campaigns, key mass customer communications, customer marketing programs, marketing channels and regulatory activities.  The group offers the opportunity to view the big picture of retail operations and marketing, as well as develop specialized knowledge in specific areas.  This team is responsible for liaising with IT, Marketing, Legal, Regulatory, Customer Care, Mass Operations and external vendor partners to accomplish results for the Residential, Small Business and Builder/Multi-Family, and Home Solar market segments. Successful team members demonstrate the ability to effectively solve problems and address issues across multiple functional groups (e.g. Marketing, Legal, Regulatory, Customer Care, Channel Management, Transaction Processing, Billing, IT, Credit/Collections, Online, Telephony, Third Party Partners, Database Operations).  Role Specific Duties/Responsibilities: Strong analytical skills with the ability to gather, organize and analyze data to identify issues and trends, quickly diagnoses root cause, recommend solutions, and drive the solution to completion  Gather, analyze and document requirements for marketing related IT and operational process changes and improvements. process and system improvement activities  Develop approach documentation, process flows, and/or business requirements for new Marketing and Operational capabilities and products needed to support metrics and responds as necessary to ensure consistently superior operational performance  Facilitate cross-functional team discussions to develop timelines for Retail campaigns, new product development and project delivery  Deliver status updates to key stakeholders at regular intervals  Manage multiple, concurrent projects and able to deliver  Address customer inquiries and escalations  Reconcile partner invoices, determine discrepancies and work to resolution  Manage vendor and partner relationships  Campaign specific: Serve as the key subject matter expert for Marketing on operational and IT capabilities, knowledgeable on all processes across customer lifecycle  Support development of ongoing operational processes for new campaigns, projects, and solutions where needed, including launch of new non-commodity products and prices to market  Facilitate report development for Mass Operations in support of projects  Product specific: Work with Product Development teams to ensure that new product documentation and requirements are complete  Communicate Product Development status regularly to key stakeholders  Manage the Product Development project queue and work with IT to prioritize through schedule conflicts and ensure timely delivery  Manage the development, implementation, testing, and launch of new Products with IT and Operations  Serve as the post-launch product expert for resolution of operational and customer concerns/questions. Name: Engineering Analyst, Investment Banking
Description: Tudor, Pickering, Holt & Co. is an integrated investment and merchant bank providing high quality advice and services to the energy industry. The company offers sales and trading, and research coverage on approximately 130 issuers worldwide. The firm’s investment management complex has more than $1.4 billion AUM dedicated to the energy space. Headquartered in Houston, Texas, TPH also has offices in Calgary, Denver, London and New York.  This dynamic 160+ person firm is seeking an Engineering Analyst to join its Investment Banking team in Houston, TX. The ideal candidate should have an engineering degree and two years of relevant experience. The role: Engineering Analysts at TPH engage in all aspects of macroeconomic, macro-energy, and asset level analysis that help drive TPH products, client interactions, and investment recommendations. Specific tasks include data accumulation, aggregation and production analysis capabilities to obtain a comprehensive understanding of asset level economics, while learning to efficiently utilize the various databases and third party services that influence TPH’s products. Therefore, we value attention to detail, strong technical abilities, and self-motivated individuals. Analysts will support investment banking teams across the energy subsectors including Oil Services, Exploration and Production, Midstream, and others. Engineering analysts are staffed on deal teams and play an integral part for the business. As such, we value maturity, interpersonal skills, and effective presentation skills. Time management is also important as analysts are often tasked with multiple assignments at one time. Finally, maintaining a collegial, dynamic, team-oriented culture is of the utmost importance at TPH and analysts will be judged on these values. Requirements: Bachelors degree in Engineering is required, Petroleum Engineering is preferred.  Tudor, Pickering, Holt & Co. is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Name: HRIS Analyst
Description: Functional Area:HR - Human Resources  Estimated Travel Percentage (%): No Travel  Relocation Provided: No  AIG Employee Services, Inc.  Our Human Resources Shared Services (HRSS) function partners with HR Business Partners (HRBP) and HR Centers of Excellence (COEs) to support business objectives, respond to customer inquiries, process HR transactions, and administer standardized functions in order to significantly reduce HRBP and COE involvement in administrative tasks. We have an exciting opportunity for an  HRIS Analyst  to join our team! You will be responsible for the day-to-day HR data entry of employee transactions. Responsibilities: Process employee transactions such as: new hires, salary changes, data changes, terminations and other employee data management transactions using Workday 2.0  Research routine to complex questions and problems and provide appropriate responses. Escalate as appropriate.  Utilize case management software to route cases to other functional areas  Manually calculate pay with extreme accuracy  Utilize time reporting systems  Maintain absolute discretion in dealing with highly confidential salary information and personal employee data  Understand and exemplify the HR Shared Services model by embracing the strategic direction of the model.  Participate in other departmental responsibilities as assigned. Qualifications: High School Diploma; College Degree preferred  1-2 years HRIS experience, preferably in a large organization  Experience working in an HR Shared Services environment helpful  Experience working with case management systems helpful (i.e; Salesforce, other similar systems)  Excellent analytical skills with attention to detail  Ability to follow standard procedures and scripts  Must have the ability to operate independently while establishing strong working relationships with co-workers and cross-functional teams  Self-motivated with critical attention to detail and deadlines.  Should possess sound work ethic and excellent communication skills to be used when providing customer service to our HR Business Partners as well working with Payroll and other internal contacts  It has been and will continue to be the policy of American International Group, Inc., its subsidiaries and affiliates to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We provide equal opportunity to all qualified individuals regardless of race, color, religion, age, gender, gender expression, national origin, veteran status, disability or any other legally protected categories.  At AIG, we believe that diversity and inclusion are critical to our future and our mission creating a foundation for a creative workplace that leads to innovation, growth, and profitability. Through a wide variety of programs and initiatives, we invest in each employee, seeking to ensure that our people are not only respected as individuals, but also truly valued for their unique perspectives.

Name: Lead IT HCM Workday Business Process Analyst
Description: Title: Lead IT HCM Workday Business Process Analyst  Location: US-US-TX-Houston  Job Number: 1075373 KBR COMPANY INFORMATION When you become part of the KBR team, your opportunities are endless. Serving our customers through diverse business units, we offer challenging assignments on some of the world's largest and most complex projects where our customers have come to value us, because they know We Deliver. Name: Analyst,Client Processing
Description: Client Processing - Performs routine and non-routine client service and transactional support functions. Interacts with other organizational units/teams to ensure timely delivery of service, or resolution of issues. Processes account related transactions per scheduled events/client authenticated direction. Following established procedures, answers inquiries, and resolves problems or issues. Manages situations which may require adaptation of response or extensive research according to client response. Escalates more complex situations to senior colleagues. Integrates area knowledge with understanding of industry standards and practices to provide solutions to internal and external clients. Performs complex operational tasks in a product or functional area. May be responsible for allocating and checking work of team members. May be responsible for specific supervisory review and approval actions. Contributes to the achievement of team objectives. Experience with data analytics, process reengineering, machine learning, database management, business analytics, statistics or economics are a plus. Strong excel skills preferred. Qualifications Bachelors degree or the equivalent combination of education and experience is required. 0-3 years of total work experience is preferred.  For over 230 years, the people of BNY Mellon have been at the forefront of finance, expanding the financial markets while supporting investors throughout the investment lifecycle. BNY Mellon can act as a single point of contact for clients looking to create, trade, hold, manage, service, distribute or restructure investments & safeguards nearly one-fifth of the world's financial assets. BNY Mellon remains one of the safest, most trusted and admired companies. Every day our employees make their mark by helping clients better manage and service their financial assets around the world. Whether providing financial services for institutions, corporations or individual investors, clients count on the people of BNY Mellon across time zones and in 35 countries and more than 100 markets. It's the collective ambition, innovative thinking and exceptionally focused client service paired with a commitment to doing what is right that continues to set us apart. Make your mark: bnymellon.com/careers.  Client Service Delivery (CSD) brings together BNY Mellon's key operational areas into one global team to better support the company's businesses and serve clients around the world. CSD helps clients to conduct business, service assets, and engage in transactions in 35 countries and more than 100 markets. At every stage of the investments lifecycle - creating, trading, clearing, settling, holding, servicing, managing, distributing and restructuring assets - CSD is working to make BNY Mellon the recognized industry service quality and productivity leader. Client Service Delivery manages investment monitoring, measurement and processing services for our clients. Our solutions include Securities Operations, Fund Administration, Transfer Agency, Outsourcing, Performance Measurement and other related services. Name: Senior Analyst Upstream
Description: Job Description Solomon, the leading performance improvement company for the global energy industry, is seeking candidates for a Senior Analyst position for its Upstream vertical. Successful candidate will help support Upstream benchmarking and custom consulting studies by assessing and applying source information related to operating costs, production efficiency, and technical data. The Analyst will support Solomon's upstream E&P onshore and offshore operating cost performance and production efficiency benchmarking studies by working with the Project Manager to collect, analyze and process client data through the utilization of multiple tools, including, but not limited to, digital platforms, Excel data and internal databases. The Analyst will support the Project Manager and assist clients as needed in understanding input data requirements, identification and clarification of potential erroneous data. The Analyst may periodically be asked to provide on sight support at the client's location to review and clarify data-related issues.  The Analyst will provide support as needed in the generation of the benchmarking reports and other custom consulting studies, as well as, contribute to the upstream study process and methodology improvement initiatives. Additionally, the Senior Analyst may be asked to assist with other efforts pertaining to Solomon in pursuit of growing the business. QualificationsEducation Required Bachelor of Science degree in Engineering, Economics or FinancePreferred:Additional training/certification in Excel, preferably Microsoft Office Specialist Expert certification in ExcelData Analytics Work Experience Required:8+ years' experience in upstream E&P operationsEngineering and/or financial experience with an operator is requiredExperience using analytical tools, including Tableau, SpotfirePreferred:Experience with Solomon or Others operations performance benchmarking studiesPrior responsibilities related to both onshore and offshore operating environmentsPrevious positions with E&P majors and independents in domestic and international operations Technical Skills Proficient in Microsoft Excel, Access, Word, and SQLStrong analytical and problem-solving skillsProficient knowledge in statistics, mathematics, and analyticsCapabilities to work on digital platforms and assist in testing of new digital toolsetKnowledge and understanding of industry and operations financial drivers for different types of operating environments (i.e. onshore versus offshore, conventional versus unconventional, primary versus secondary recovery, etc.)Non-Technical Skills:Strong communication skills and professionalism are required to engage in both written and oral dialogue with clientsGood teamworking skills. Must possess a collaborative nature and actively participate in teamsMust be able to work effectively with members in multiple locations worldwideShould possess excellent organizational skills and a high level of attention to detailOther Requirements:Potential for travel up to 15% of the time; domestic and internationalJob location preference is in Houston. Calgary is optional Employment Type  Full Time Additional Information We are an equal opportunity employer. Description: Role Summary: As a key member of the IT payroll team you will implement IT solutions in support of Payroll in the Finance Global Business Services area and be accountable for ensuring delivery of Enterprise IT solutions and support globally. You will partner with our Enterprise Finance Organization leaders from initial concepts and evaluation, through design, development, deployment and support. Specific areas of responsibility includes: Payroll, Time Management, and Cross Application time sheets. Essential Responsibilities: In the role of Sr. IT Payroll Configurator and Business Process Analyst, you will: Design, specify, implement, and maintain automated and manual systems and designs, specifies, codes, tests, maintains, and documents computer programs Coordinate user support efforts and crafts solutions to complex problems Provide technical leadership on complex projects Lead project/work teams and instructs, directs and checks the work of less experienced personnel Communicate effectively across the organization Manage customer expectations including the evaluation of risk, generating alternatives, and balances priorities Understand current business initiatives, technology trends and best practices for value creation Pragmatic solution builder that understands the balance between process, people and technology Work collaboratively with peer IT colleagues Adheres and improves shared IT procedures Establish alliances and foster affinity and team spirit Ensure clear definition of problem statement, business case and scope. Seeks project value realization. Ensures appropriate project management best practices are adhered to Perform other duties as assigned Qualifications/Requirements:Bachelor's Degree in Business, Computer Science, Engineering or other technical field from an accredited college or university Minimum 5 years of progressive SAP HCM experience focusing on Time and Payroll in a Global Organization Desired Characteristics:Ability to lead payroll-related projects with expertise in systems analysis, process design, systems design, configuration and implementations Ability to gather requirements essential in preparing Business Requirements documents and assist developer with Functional Design Specifications SAP experience related to development of functional specifications for interfaces, legacy conversions Assist in user training and after go-live support Excellent verbal and written communication skills Customer service focused Ability to cultivate and maintain strong working relationships Ability to work in a fast-paced, often changing, and sometimes ambiguous environment Good organizational skills; able to assemble and present information clearly Balance multiple priorities successfully Detail oriented Ownership, Leadership and Can-Do attitude is essential for success Extensive knowledge of payroll processes and related system installations, conversions, interfaces and support Ability to lead and implement continuous improvement processes About Us:Baker Hughes, a GE company (NYSE:BHGE) is the worlds first and only fullstream provider of integrated oilfield products, services and digital solutions. Drawing on a storied heritage of invention, BHGE harnesses the passion and experience of its people to enhance productivity across the oil and gas value chain.BHGE helps its customers acquire, transport and refine hydrocarbons more efficiently, productively and safely, with a smaller environmental footprint and at lower cost per barrel. Backed by the digital industrial strength of GE, the company deploys minds, machines and the cloud to break down silos and reduce waste and risk, applying breakthroughs from other industries to advance its own.With operations in over 120 countries, the companys global scale, local know-how and commitment to service infuse over a century of experience with the spirit of a startup inventing smarter ways to bring energy to the world.Follow Baker Hughes, a GE company on Twitter @BHGECo, or visit us at BHGE.com. Name: Sr Analyst, Retail Ops
Description: Sr Analyst, Retail Ops - (214641)DescriptionAt Exelon, we've got a place for you!  Join the nation's leading competitive energy provider, with one of the largest electricity generation portfolios and retail customer bases in the country. You will be part of a family of companies that strives for the highest standards of power generation, competitive energy sales, and energy delivery. Our team of outstanding professionals is focused on performance, thought leadership, innovation, and the power of ideas that come from a diverse and inclusive workforce.  Exelon will provide you the tools and resources you need to design, build and enhance a successful career. We are also dedicated to motivating the success of our employees through competitive base salary, incentives, and health and retirement benefits.  Join Exelon and share your passion at a forward-thinking Fortune 150 company. Establish yourself in a place where you can truly shine and create a brighter, more sustainable tomorrow. Energize your career at Exelon! Constellation is headquartered in Baltimore, with regional offices in Chicago, Houston, Kennett Square, Louisville, New York, and Omaha.We develop energy management strategies that help customers buy, manage and consume energy.  Our retail unit is among the largest and most comprehensive in the industry with approximately 1 million residential customers that rely on our commitment to innovation, dependability, transparency, and service.  Our wholesale business serves utilities, municipalities and co-ops and features world-class risk management and energy trading capabilities.PRIMARY PURPOSE OF POSITION Constellation is seeking a qualified professional with proven experience and results to join our Retail Operations team as a Senior Analyst to be located in our Houston office.  The Senior Analyst position within Retail Operations is the subject matter expert during escalations and provide cross function communications across the organization. The Senior Analyst will monitor the day-to-day workflow activities for the functional team and provide quality performance reporting for the targeted deliverables. The Senior Analyst will provide leadership and feedback to team members and champion teamwork across the functional team. The Senior Analyst is responsible for managing process improvement activities and leading cross-functional team education as well as team training for the assigned workflow areas.  PRIMARY DUTIES AND ACCOUNTABILITIES Workflow Monitoring and Performance Reporting: Monitor day-to-day workflow activities for the functional team to ensure work performed by team members is high quality, timely and in compliance with operational objectives. Communicate functional team’s progress, status and issues to management. Report targeted and obtained deliverables. Cross Functional Communications and Escalations: Drive interaction and communication between functional team and internal and external stakeholders. Serve as escalation point of contact for internal and external customer issues impacting the team. Serve as Subject Matter Expert (SME) on cross functional teams and projects across the organization.Workflow Improvement and Functional Knowledge Collaboration:Initiate process improvements and cross-functional team education and training for assigned workflow areas. Support and drive interaction between team members and other functional teams. Participate and lead both tactical and strategic system improvement projects, including requirement gathering, solution design, testing, and system deployment. Team Leadership and Team Development Support: Provide leadership and feedback to team members and champion teamwork across the functional team. Work strategically to identify the need for system or process changes and workload reallocation based on changing business needs and assign work to team members accordingly. Work with manager to develop and implement team level plans addressing communication, leadership, technical skill training, and increasing industry knowledge. Comprehension/Adherence of Policies and Controls: Maintain an advanced understanding of UDC/ISO market rules and ensure own group and other groups within Operations are following current market requirements. Ensure that all Sarbanes-Oxley (“SOX”) Key Controls and other company policies are followed.QualificationsPOSITION SPECIFICATIONSMinimum: • Bachelor’s degree required, although candidates with 7 or more years in equivalent business experience will be considered  • Advanced skills with Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Access)  • Ability to communicate effectively and professionally with internal and external parties as required  • Can obtain and analyze data without supervision and can reason through complex scenarios to suggest course of action or remediation  • Effectively communicate with, develop and maintain professional relationships with internal and external customers  • Excellent attention to detail knowing others will depend on it being correct  • Works independently and as a team member  • Strong organizational and time management skills - ability to organize and prioritize a fast-paced, heavy workload  • Adapts to changing markets, systems, and processes  • Works in tight deadlines and shifting priorities but continues to be organized and methodical Preferred: • Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Finance, Management, Management Information Technology or Supply Chain Management  • Prior experience in the retail energy industry and/or regulated energy industry  • Prior experience in using CRM and/or Order-to-Cash workflow systems  • Working knowledge of UDC/ISO market EDI transactions  • Advanced skills in Microsoft Access and/or SQL database query development  Exelon is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and employees or applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to: age, color, disability, gender, national origin, race, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, or any other classification protected by federal, state, or local law. Name: Business Systems Analyst (Koch Heat Transfer)
Description: Who are we? Watch to find out!Follow Koch Industries onLinkedInWho are we? Watch to find out!WE ARE KOCH Koch Heat Transfer is seeking an IT Manufacturing Lead at our headquarters in Houston, Texas.  The Koch Heat Transfer group builds on the strength of its companies, incorporating a market-based business philosophy with continuous improvement and development of heat transfer technology for the refining, chemical and upstream industries. The group is built on globally-recognized brands in the tubular heat transfer business, such as BROWN FINTUBE®, ALCO™, ALCO-TWIN™ and BOS-HATTEN™ products. Today we are recognized as a world leader in the supply of specialized and standard shell and tube heat exchangers, double pipe, multi-tube hairpin, and tank heater equipment, including finned tubes. Headquartered in Houston, Texas, the Koch Heat Transfer group is represented in every major country, with manufacturing facilities in the United States (Koch Heat Transfer Company, LP), Canada (Koch Heat Transfer Canada, LP) and sales offices all over the world.  Koch Heat Transfer is hiring an IT Manufacturing Lead who connects with the business to develop and maintain strong working relationships, internalize business strategies, and optimize value capture while supporting digital transformation. We are looking for an individual with strong solution development and IT project management skills. The successful candidate must have good critical thinking skills, self-starter and be willing to stretch themselves both within IT and outside of the IT environment. The person in this role will report to the CIO/President. A Day In The Life COULD Include:Lead the IT capability for Koch Heat Transfer.Analyze business IT systems, identify key requirements, and validate systems to ensure they meet the needs of internal customers.Develop plans and objectives for the Koch Heat Transfer IT capability in order to improve quality of offerings, reduce costs, and position for growth.Partner with the business to align and find opportunities to integrate technology and deliver value added solutions.Participate in systems implementation projects (i.e. requirements documentation, systems configuration, test documentation and execution, issue identification and resolution).Provide in-depth knowledge of the ERP system and identify key business requirements.Manage project scope by thoroughly understanding the business culture, environment and people.Plan, prioritize, and deliver systems enhancements.Support and upgrade implemented systems.Understand enterprise software needs and match those needs with the best available products.Stay up-to-date with new technologies and applications – Innovation is a key priority.Manage IT compliance with policies and regulations.Lead, follow and embrace all the Safety Procedures.Understand and apply Koch’s Market-Based Management® and MBM Guiding Principles.What You Will Need To Bring With You (Requirements):Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, MIS, or related field from an accredited institution.5+ years working experience in IT and on IT Solution Development using modern development platforms (such as .Net, C++, C)5+ years of Project Management experienceExperience working in a Manufacturing Environment3+ years’ experience with SQL Server1+ years’ experience with Office 365 SuiteWilling to travel 10% (domestic and some Canadian Travel)What Will Put You Ahead (Preferred):7+ years’ IT experience working at a manufacturing siteExperience with INFOR LN / VISIBILITY ERP Systems.Experience with MS SharePoint Development.Experience with Microsoft Developer Certifications (MCPD, MCSD or MCAD).Experience with Web Development.Proven track record of enabling business outcome through the application of technology.Experience with cloud technologies and data analytics concepts.Why work for Koch Companies?A culture that places top priority on integrity and complianceOpportunity for career growth at one of the largest, financially stable companies in the worldEncouragement to challenge the status quo and share knowledgeAccess to professional training and mentoringResponsibilities and rewards based on contributions rather than seniorityContinued company growth due to reinvesting 90% of our earnings Based in Wichita, Kan., Koch Industries, Inc. is one of the largest private companies in America with estimated annual revenues as high as $115 billion, according to Forbes. It owns a diverse group of companies involved in refining, chemicals, grain processing and biofuels; forest and consumer products; fertilizers; polymers and fibers; process and pollution control equipment and technologies; electronic components; commodity trading; minerals; energy; ranching; glass; and investments. Since 2003, Koch companies have invested approximately $65 billion in acquisitions and other capital expenditures. With a presence in about 60 countries, Koch companies employ more than 100,000 people worldwide, with about 60,000 of those in the United States. From January 2009 to present, Koch companies have earned more than 930 awards for safety, environmental excellence, community stewardship, innovation, and customer service. For more news and stories, visit www.kochnews.com.  The businesses’ popular consumer brands include Brawny® paper towels, Quilted Northern® and Angel Soft® bath tissue, Dixie® tabletop products, LYCRA® fiber, STAINMASTER® carpet and more. Name: Financial/Inventory Cost Analyst
Description: Job Summary: Collects, reviews and analyzes data to evaluate cost of inventory, while maintaining compliance to GAAP on lower cost or market as well as operational opportunities to leverage existing inventory on hand. Position provides finance and business-related reports and makes recommendations to operational leaders in the company. Liaise between plants, operations and financial teams. Duties and Responsibilities:Conducts special financial and business-related studies and leads cross-functional interaction to prepare the analysis. Delivers and communicates the work products.Develops tools to help analyze inventoryPerforms cost accounting as needed to understand changes in the manufacturing environmentProvides detailed cost information not supplied by general accounting systems, applying principles of cost accounting.Gathers and studies data to determine costs of business activity, such as raw material purchases, inventory, and labor.Analyzes changes in our process such as raw material variances or manufacturing methods to determine effects on costs.Conducts statistical and financial analysis recommending required levels of inventory based on production & demand schedules while minimizing inventory and carrying costs.Analyzes actual manufacturing costs, and prepares periodic report comparing standard costs to actual production costs.Provides management with reports specifying and comparing factors affecting prices and profitability of products or services.Complete Quarterly lower cost or market testing.Aid in testing and implementation of our Production Inventory ERP cost accounting system.Interfaces with Plant Managers and Directors of Operations as required in areas of production orders, physical inventory counts, and operational planning.Performs other duties and projects, as assignedQualifications and Requirements:Bachelors degree in Finance, Accounting or Business, or equivalent work experience3-5 years professional experience in a financial analyst, accounting, or similar positionAdvanced Excel skills, with proficiency in various other office and software programsExcellent analytical skillsStrong, effective problem-solving skillsFamiliar with a variety of the concepts, practices and procedures of accounting and operationsExcellent verbal and written communication skillsSelf starter- motivated to initiate tasks and work without supervisionTeam player, interacts well with executives, supervisors and peersGlass processing, aggregates or manufacturing experience, a plus

Name: Software Configuration Senior Analyst - Location Negotiable / Remote
Description: Job descriptionMortgage Cadence, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Accenture, has been partnering with mortgage lenders since 1999, offering the industry’s only true one-stop shop mortgage technology solutions designed for point-of-sale through post-closing. In a time when efficiency, speed and the customer experience are paramount to the success of lenders, Mortgage Cadence offers the most reliable software and dedicated people, supporting lenders every step of the way. Each of our products has revolutionized the mortgage lending process in some way, changing the way lenders lend and borrowers finance. As a software company, we think like a start-up, with every employee empowered and encouraged to be visionary. Teamwork and innovation define what we do as we take our customers into the future by providing the last lending solution they will ever need.Job Description:Looking for an individual with approximately 3 or more years of work experience who is eager to learn software and  systems analysis in a software development environment. This role is responsible for loan origination system  configuration, business requirement interpretation, database mapping efforts utilizing SQL Management Studio, and  knowledge of process documentation workflow. This position requires hands on configuration of software and  systems and the coordination and problem solving processes to ensure that the business standards and requirements  are met. It would be considered a plus if this individual has experience in VB or C or Mortgage software  experience, but is not required.+ Basic qualificationsMinimum of 3 years of experience with Microsoft SQL Management Studio Minimum of 1 experience in workflow process designMinimum of 1 year experience writing business rules decision logic within a rules engine.Minimum of 1 year experience in writing testing business and functional requirements.Professional skills:Process focused mindset.Results oriented attitude.- Self starter requiring little direction  Desire to make a difference.Proven multi tasking capabilities.Exceptional attention to detail and accuracy.Ability to prioritize and coordinate multiple projects simultaneously.Creative, outgoing and professional demeanor.Excellent communication skills, both oral and written.Proactive and a team player.- Knowledge of Visual Basic VB , C , LOS Loan Origination System , and Mortgage processing  Experience with Microsoft SQL ServerAll of our consulting professionals receive comprehensive training covering business acumen, technical and professional skills development. You'll also have opportunities -to hone your functional skills and expertise in an area of specialization. We offer a variety of formal and informal training programs at every level to help you acquire and build specialized skills faster. Learning takes place both on the job and through formal training conducted online, in the classroom, or in collaboration with teammates. The sheer variety of work we do, and the experience it offers, provide an unbeatable platform from which to build a career.  Applicants for employment in the US must have work authorization that does not now or in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the United States and with Accenture (i.e., H1-B visa, F-1 visa (OPT), TN visa or any other non-immigrant status).  Candidates who are currently employed by a client of Accenture or an affiliated Accenture business may not be eligible for consideration.  Accenture is a Federal Contractor and an EEO and Affirmative Action Employer of Females/Minorities/Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities.  Equal Employment Opportunity  All employment decisions shall be made without regard to age, race, creed, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, citizenship status or any other basis as protected by federal, state, or local law. Name: Payroll Cust Srvc Analyst
Description: Overview & ResponsibilitiesGENERAL ACCOUNTABILITIES Serves as the first line of customer support as a payroll analyst, providing operational support to the various payroll functions, field operations, legal department and employees. This is a non-exempt, hourly role - perfect for someone with a couple years' of experience. SPECIFIC RESPONSIBILITIES 85% Operations Support• Monitor and manage case tracking system (HEAT) incidents for the Payroll Systems and Support team. Ensuring correct assignment, SLA’s and back up procedures are followed• Document issues and solutions on payroll teams Wiki page, as well as ensure adequate communication of problem resolutions• Provide ad-hoc reports to various levels of management• Owner of garnishment processing. This includes managing our vendor relationship (OSV), processing orders, refunds and weekly funding, balancing and auditing deductions, auditing and approving invoices. As well as investigating and supporting escalated employee issues/questions.• Provide earnings registers, time sheets and pay slips for legal requests• Maintain yearly PUCAR spreadsheet and process, ensuring deductions within Workday are made properly, and year end true up is accurate• Owner of pay card inventory and requests• Process returned checks as received, and quarterly escheatment audit• Miscellaneous projects as assigned  15% Process Improvement• Recommend and participate in the development of new functional processes based on previous resolution of issues• Proactively identify departmental process or procedural obstacles and make recommendations for resolution or revision• Maintain and document all processes (Job Aides) for the Systems and Support team CORE / CRITICAL COMPETENCIES Demonstrates a Commitment to Services Excellence, Trustworthiness and Integrity• Builds trust with others by following through on commitments • Conducts oneself ethically in personal and business interactions  Promote Innovation• Brings perspectives and approaches together, combining them in creative ways• Generates and champions new ideas and initiatives  Achieve Results• Pursues challenging goals; Shows a strong drive to achieve meaningful results• Anticipates potential roadblocks and challenges.• Proactively raises and/or resolves issues as they arise  Displays Adaptability• Works productively in the face of multiple demands, shifting priorities, and rapid change  Communicate Effectively• Conveys information clearly and concisely in written and spoken communication• Expresses self clearly and appropriately in group and individual interactions• Listens actively, acknowledges and summarizes others’ comments to ensure understanding• Conveys facts and information clearly in written and spoken communications  Collaborate with Others• Readily involves others appropriately to accomplish individual and group goals • Invites and builds on the ideas, input and feedback received from others  Build Productive Relationships (Internal / External)• Initiates and develops productive relationships with others; relates to others in an open, respectful and approachable manner• Manages disagreements tactfully, working toward win-win situationsRequirements & QualificationsEducation: • Some college coursework  Experience:• Three (3) to five (5) years of relevant payroll experience• WorkDay experience preferred but not required  Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:• Knowledge in Microsoft Office Suite• Excellent communication, customer service and analytical skills• Ability to grasp concepts quickly and be a creative problem solver• Ability to work independently, manage multiple tasks and meet changing deadlines• Understanding of a large volume payroll and HR processes WORK CONDITIONS Work Environment• Work indoors during all seasons and weather conditions• Limited amount of local and/or multiple location traveling  Work Postures• Sitting continuously for many hours per day, up to 8 hours per day• Climbing stairs to access buildings.  Physical Demands• Physical effort requiring manual dexterity is required, includes paperwork, calculators, computers and phone usage  Work HoursWhen considering the work hours associated with this job, the following factors may apply:• Working beyond “standard” hours as the need arisesSCI OverviewWho we are. What we do. We’re more than North America’s largest provider of funeral, cremation and cemetery services. We are mothers, fathers, sisters, brothers, sons and daughters who are devoted to the communities where we live and work. We are more than 20,000 dedicated individuals who provide caring assistance to families in need, honor veterans and public servants and deliver lifesaving programs to help keep children and seniors safe.  We operate under the umbrella of the Dignity Memorial network of 1,800 funeral homes and cemeteries. Dignity Memorial providers care for more than 300,000 families each year and understand the importance of thoughtful, personalized arrangements. We believe creating meaningful ways to pay tribute to a loved one begins with compassion and is shaped by the understanding that each life is truly unique. For us, there is no greater responsibility than honoring and preserving the story of one’s life. Benefits Options:Health benefits (medical, dental, vision, life)401K Retirement Savings Plan with company matchVacation and sick timeTuition reimbursementFuneral discounts, and more SCI offers advanced on-line training resources, career advancement opportunities in the largest organization in the industry, attractive benefits, and a wonderful community to serve with plenty of culture and personality. For additional information regarding our company, please visit our corporate site at www.sci-corp.com. As used herein, “SCI” refers to Service Corporation International and its affiliated companies.Equal Opportunity Employer, M/F/D/V

Name: Senior Financial Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionMiller Grossbard Advisors, LLP is looking for a candidate to join their T.A.S.C. Team (Technology and Strategic Consulting). A T.A.S.C. team member works as a partner with a variety of clients on various types of engagements. This is a challenging, fun position that will bring your Accounting skills to the next level. Job Responsibilities Include:Communicating project progress to clients on a regular basis both in written form and visiting client offices for face to face meetings.Communicating with Manager and Director (really over-communicating) where client deliverables stand, providing suggestions for process improvements or "fixes" for client books, making sure that the Management staff is informed and no deliverables fall through the cracks.Tech savvy individual who is will jump into different systems, vet them, kick the tires, and confirm back to Mgt if the system is viable for a client. Implementing new systems for clients (typically, QBO, bill.com, receipt bank, but could be other systems that you research and decide are best for the client).Provide process improvement suggestions, document processes and/or improvements for clients, and train clients on processes.Vast understanding of financial statements and capable of both completing a month end close independently as well as review the financials of an organization produced by the client.The ability to make journal entries (accruals, reclasses, revenue, payroll), intercompany reconciliations, credit card reconciliations, bank reconciliations, and upload entries into QuickBooksUpdate cash flow forecasts on a weekly basis with a solid understanding of Accounts Payable and Accounts ReceivablesUnderstands payroll and has used an online payroll service like ADP or Paychex to report and book payroll expense on a bi-weekly basisCapable of jumping between tasks/clients needs, but still finishes tasks in an effective and efficient mannerThe ability to offer suggestions on how to book journal entries, fix g/l accounts, and correct issues in the ledgerQualifications:Minimum five years of recent experience with full cycle accountingBachelor’s Degree in Accounting and/or FinanceQuickBooks Enterprise Edition (a recent version) a must, QuickBooks online also a mustStrong Excel skills (VLOOKUP, sumifs, pivot tables, advanced formulas)Organized, self starter that can complete tasks without regular supervisionMust be accustomed to owning their workload and handle multiple tasks with easeExperience dealing with multiple clients and entities is a huge plusProcess improver, idea maker, problem solver, innovative, with a good personalityMastering the ability to multi-task while working with multiple companies Company DescriptionAt MGA, our approach is simple. We’re not about services rendered. We’re about relationships. Our highly experienced professionals—the best in their field—expertly help you navigate every financial intricacy, from tax preparation and planning to assurance services to business sales to a sound succession plan. Maintaining the highest level of professional excellence, our team collaborates with you and your team to find the best solutions, creating the greatest value for you and your stakeholders. We make the complex simple. Contact us and let’s get started.

Name: Senior Cost Controls Analyst
Description: Senior Cost Controls AnalystApply NowSUMMARYThis position is responsible for providing project controls services to individual commercial opportunities and to individual growth and maintenance capital projects.KEY RESPONSIBILITIESFacilitate data collection for preparation of project to include, but not limited to, cost estimates, forecasting budgets and schedules.Develop and maintain project budget control system to monitor project actual incurred cost against target budget, risk management, document control, etc.Assist in developing and monitoring annual capital budgets for business unit as it relates to project control.Assist business unit management in systematically tracking project progress, contract invoicing, preparing estimates and collecting data in dispute resolution.Assist the Project Director in monitoring and controlling contractor and vendor charges, evaluating contractor bids and proposals for assigned projects and recommending contractor agreements for management approval.Collect and maintain current cost data on vendor services, material, equipment and construction.Consolidate data and prepare weekly and/or monthly activity reports to management.Abide by Company policies and procedures.Other duties and special projects as assigned.EXPERIENCE AND EDUCATION REQUIREMENTSTo perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. A Bachelor’s degree is required; preferably in Construction Management, Engineering, Business or Finance.Should have 5-10 years of specific work experience in US gas sources, gas transport and midstream markets.Must have knowledge of liquid and gas gathering, transportation, project capital and operating expenditure, project planning and project performance measurement.Must be a detail oriented, self-starter and able to work with little supervision while maintaining goals/tasks.Must have good PC skills to include all MS Office products.Must have good written and verbal communication skills and able to effectively communicate with staff, management, customers and vendors. Being multi-lingual is preferred.Must possess sound reasoning skills and have the ability to follow directions.
